好感人，好气氛，好游戏，好音乐，不够玩，快出新TAT
<3 just love super cool
Honestly best representation for younger teen characters, as well as the best story line I 100% recommend this to people who love story-focused choice-matters games. 10/10

эта игра мне жизнь сломала, одобряем всем поселком. нора моя красотка =DDDDD однозначно стоило моих шестисот гривен
хочу третью кассету, я не наигрался((((
из недостатков: местами бывает скучно, одновременно и затянуто и слишком быстро. некоторые неинтересные главы идут чуть ли не полчаса, а к концовке нас подвели сразу после поджога ранчо, когда только дошло что и как. что такое бездна никто так и не понял. делать мейн антагонистом кори было тупо, у него нет бэкграунда и всю игру он ведет себя как мудила, а его мотивацию мы должны угадать сами. но при этом мотивация каждой девочки из основной четверки мне понятна, но имхо на 16 лет их поведение не тянет, максимум на 14, лол. с концерта вот я кринжанул знатно, хотя музончик четкий хд
в 1 кассете взаимодействия со взрослыми отэм и норой ни к чему, очень отвлекают от истории ( что находится в коробке было изначально понятно и мува с ней я не понял. с технической стороны очень много ЛаГоВ и БаГоВ даже на мощном компе, оптимизация на нуле. размытие слетает, тени тоже, в рандомный момент фризит и тормозит, жрет оперативку похлеще чем любая другая игра. решения так и не нашел, с компом все отлично
но вот сама игра - сплошной плюс. история девочек офигенная и меня пробивало на слезы, я очень проникся ими. катсцены классные, я очень люблю кэт и ее историю. иногда стыдно за них, но в этом есть свой прикол. концовка была не очень понятная и жаль что это, скорее всего, конец и никаких длс и продолжения не будет. девочек раскрыли замечательно и очень круто передали атмосферу города. короче, донтноды, спасибо вам за эту игру, от души !
Самое грустное во что либо я играл когда-то...

God, I wish Steam had a third button for mediocre games. Because this is a game that I didn't enjoy, but I don't hate it this much as to mark it with a thumbs down. So it is a "kinda yes BUT". Also this is spoiler free, although the story has 0 plot twists to spoil. 

First of all, the story SUFFERS from an identity crisis. It doesn't know what it wants to be. 75% of the time is a coming of age story of four girls that meet during the summer. And it does a decent job in fleshing out the characters and building the relationships among them. BUT then for the 25% of the story it wants to be a Stephen King horror story that absolutely destroys the other part. The horror is nice and it has some nice moments, but it is totally out of place that could be omitted altoghether.

As of that, the characters suffer tremendously as they too act in a lot of strange ways. Kat is the perfect example. On one instance she is vulnerable and sensitive and she reads Emily f-ing Dickinson. And literally on the next acts like she the goddess of vengeance, full of rage and wrath and fury. The same happens with Autumn and Nora. My take is that because the story breaks down to four protagonists, these four must adapt to the plot points so you have them act out of character in order to fit the plot and stay together

In terms of gameplay, the camera gimmick is the main thing THAT DOES ABSOLUTELY NOTHING OF VALUE OR WORTHWHILE. I mean, ok, you record these memoirs. What are they for? Why should I edit them? You could really forget about the camera and the game won't bring it back once. Apart from the "remembering how to break in" sequence, the camera is useless. And they could do SO MUCH MORE WITH THAT.

Don't get me wrong. The game has its moments. BUT it squanders them every time, throws away all the potential itself sets up. Dylan is a side character yet is the only one that shines, as the game shows momentarily her struggles. Even the villain shows some moments of redemption, only for the game to drop it. It feels as if the story tries so hard to be something, but all this trying makes its failures even more noticeable.  

Another game that fails to capture the magic of the first Life is Strange.
I truly loved this game. Such a heartfelt story about young teens, and learning to remember, but also moving on. A tragic story, but a fantastic one. Thank you DONT NOD :)

Que jogo incrível, personagens queridos, uma história muito interessante e uma trilha sonara maravilhosa, adorei as duas fitas e espero a continua??o para resolver o que ficou em aberto nesse primeiro jogo.

This game is a narrative masterpiece, combining supernatural elements with emotional connections in a way that makes you feel connected to the story and drawn to everything that's happening. 

The 1995 timeline is definitely more eventful and impactful, but that definitely doesn't take away from the emotionally packed 2022 timeline. The relationships between the characters feels very fluid, especially in the teen timeline, since you really feel like you are playing as a group of teenage girls from the 90's (cringe sometimes, but faithful to the era).

The game differs slightly in pacing from other Don't Nod narrative games, having only 2 tapes, which might feel a little short. However, the developers' approach to the narrative development feels very natural and well-paced.

If you miss the vibe of the early Life is Strange games, you will definitely love this game. Everything from the ambiance and character design to the story is carefully crafted to create an emotional journey that makes you attached to each character, hoping to understand just a little more of their stories.

This game is definitely a must if you like narrative-heavy games where choices matter, because with each choice you make, you can actually see it affect the story and change how the game plays out.

DontNod surprised me. After all this years. Again. 
First Life is Strange was a masterpiece. Their other games was never on that level since... until now. 
I was sceptical about Bloom & Rage, my friend pushed me to buy and play it. And I had one of the best narrative experience of last years. Rich and complex characters, deep story. Heartfelt and brilliantly crafted dialogues. This game really touched me.

Depois de infelizmente n?o ter feito o novo Life is Strange, a Don't Nod vem com seu jogo, dos mesmos criadores e com semelhan?as bem notáveis, mas que n?o consegue passar de meras semelhan?as com seu primo distante. Novamente temos aqui uma narrativa com um foco mais emocional e um jogo com extremo foco na narrativa, mas que como sempre também possui suas mecanicas para incrementar. Jogando a primeira parte, eu estava bem satisfeito, o jogo demora para embalar, e você leva um tempo para se conectar com os personagens, ele n?o tem um ritmo t?o gostoso quanto LIS, mas consegue ser competente e divertido. A mecanica de grava??o e como ela se mantém presente por todo jogo, até fazendo uma apari??o no final, quer dizer, o filme do ver?o é literalmente feito por você, isso é muito legal, quando chega o momento você n?o só lembra dos eventos do jogo, mas de como você jogou cada um deles. Mas, nem tudo s?o flores, e devo dizer que detestei a ideia de ter que esperar a segunda parte, eu n?o sei se teve algum motivo específico para isso, mas devo dizer que atrapalhou muito minha experiência. Para quem vai comprar e jogar agora, isso n?o é mais um problema, você consegue fazer tudo de uma vez, o que é MUITO melhor, desde o dia que terminei a primeira parte, eu joguei outras coisas completamente diferentes, desde o novo Assassin's Creed até o melhor jogo já feito em toda a história, e quando voltei para jogar a segunda parte, eu n?o lembrava nem os bot?es. 

Depois da primeira parte terminar emocionando, com um baita plot surgindo, o tempo que isso ficou de molho na minha cabe?a n?o me fez criar expectativa para o desfecho, mas me fez perder a euforia e toda a emo??o do final da primeira parte, resumindo, esperar para jogar o restante só deixou tudo gelado e meio irrelevante. Mudando de assunto, acredito que vale mencionar a excelente qualidade gráfica deste jogo, desde sempre a Don't Nod vem trazendo esse estilo cartoon que é esteticamente muito bonito, e agora combinado com os efeitos de ilumina??o, além do maior realismo gráfico no geral, o resultado final é uma pintura, você pode nem gostar do jogo, mas várias vezes vai querer tirar uma foto do que está na tela. 

Sinceramente, eu n?o tenho muito mais sobre o que falar, mas no fim das contas, eu recomendo, agora que a segunda parte já está disponível pode ser uma boa aquisi??o, o jogo é bom, e para quem é f? de LIS será divertido. Além disso, ele n?o é t?o caro e tem uma dura??o legal, também um bom fator replay, para tentar novas escolhas ou ao menos focar nos colecionáveis.




PS (SPOILER): Vale também citar o qu?o ridículo foi o jogo te fazer aceitar a morte da Kat, para depois surgir dizendo que talvez ela esteja viva no abismo, por que a gente n?o pode aceitar a vida triste do jeito que ela é? N?o seria justo, mas seria o real.

Rift of the NecroDancer чувствуется как хорошая ритм-игра со своими особенностями. Не понимаю людей, которые в своих отзывах пишут, что это очередной клон Guitar Hero. 90% всех ритм-игр это так или иначе клон GH, за исключением Осу, Таико и BPM. RotND за свою цену предлагает Melanin+Funkin с тремя кнопками, мастерской и нормальным чартингом. Для тех, кто жалуется на платные ДЛС и заработок на франшизе - купите (именно КУПИТЕ) DJMAX RESPECT V со всеми дополнениями за 21к рубленных, а потом посмотрите трейлер, ведь именно его вы и получите. Как итог, RotND просто нуждается в большем разнообразии контента, но это не мешает ей быть добротной ритм-игрой.

I think I first heard about this game after trying out the demo at PAX West 2022, and I've been looking forward to its release since then. I'm glad the game's out and feel that it was completely worth the wait. Others have said that some of the songs are better than others, but as long as the "better" ones play great (they do) and the "worse" ones aren't unpleasant to go through (they aren't), the experience as a whole ends up being very satisfying. I suck at rhythm games and don't play them too often, so I appreciate having a training mode and more than enough difficulty levels to choose from.

Particularly enjoyed the boss fights, I think what Brace Yourself Games did to them was very cool. The custom song compatibility is also awesome. It's awesome to see developers embracing this feature, unlike some locksmiths or whatever they're called.

The bottom line - with the polished art, sick soundtrack, and the custom tracks, the game is a fun experience at a fair price. I strongly recommend it, but mostly because [spoiler] it's set in the prettiest city in the world[/spoiler].

Après 12 h de jeu, j'ai l'impression d'avoir largement fait le tour de la question. 
Le sentiment général est celui d'un jeu de rythme bien pensé et con?u en terme de gameplay - ?a ne réinvente rien mais c'est efficace - mais un peu chiche pour ce qui est du contenu. Déjà on est un peu surpris en ouvrant le jeu la première fois de voir que le mode histoire est relégué en bas du menu, l'entrée "JOUER" amenant directement sur la set-list à débloquer, sans vraiment de contexte. 
Ce mode histoire donc suit le même déroulé, mais avec des cut-scenes, des mini-jeux et des combats de boss. Et si la prémisse est plut?t amusante et semble avoir un certain potentiel (les personnages du monde médiéval fantasy du 1er jeu se retrouvent téléportés dans un monde "moderne") on comprend très vite que les développeurs n'ont pas vraiment cherché à aller plus loin que ?a tant le récit réussit le tour de force d'être à la fois bizarrement confus, curieusement répétitif et assez peu passionnant. Passé la découverte, les mini-jeu débiles ne donnent pas envie d'y revenir (celui de l'émission de télé est, pour être honnête, assez incompréhensible) et les combats de boss, une fois compris le principe, sont tout aussi peu passionnant à exécuter. 
Reste évidemment le "core" de tout cela : la musique. Alors oui les compositions sont de bonnes factures (certaines sont même excellentes) et le petit frissons quand on arrive à caler des rythmes parfaits advient assez régulièrement. Même si le comportement parfois absurde des personnages sur la grille peut agacer et rendre tout cela un peu punitif. Vous me direz, c'est le jeu... mais pour avoir testé un peu le mode "impossible", voir un blob jaune (note normale qu'il faut marquer 3 fois) arriver en même temps qu'une wyverne (note longue) ET tout de suite après une harpie (saute 1 rythme) peut causer une petite confusion dans les doigts au point où on se demande s'il est vraiment possible de jouer cet encha?nement... Enfin j'imagine que les amateurs de challenge corsés y trouvent leur compte. 
Mais le vrai soucis (pour moi qui aime bien ces jeux de rythmes) est qu'aussi qualitative que soit la production musicale, la trentaine de morceaux proposés ont tendance à se ressembler un peu. Non ce ne sont pas exactement les mêmes remixé à chaque fois, bien entendu, mais on est jamais vraiment bousculé pas cette musique globalement rock/éléctro qui utilise toujours un peu les mêmes motifs. Il aurait été plaisant d'avoir certains morceaux changeant radicalement de style (Jazz, Rock, même disco ou pourquoi pas country ou chants...) pour sortir un peu tout cela d'une routine. Je crois que sur les 30 morceaux disponibles (sans DLC), 2 me sont vraiment restés en tête... Comme je disais, les autres ne sont pas mauvais, mais on a quelques difficultés à les séparer les uns des autres. 
Enfin, pour conclure sur le contenu un peu chiche : terminer des chansons permet d'obtenir des diamants qui, il semblerait, vous permettent d'acheter d'autres chansons... que de toute fa?on vous allez débloquer en complétant la chanson précédente. C'est tout. Donc là j'ai accumulé une centaine de diamants qui ne me servent absolument à rien puisqu'il n'y a rien d'autre a acheter dans le jeu que les chansons que j'ai débloqués par d'autres moyens... Le jeu vous annonce aussi que "vous avez débloqué XXXX" qui est en fait le bloc de chansons affilié à un personnage, mais pas le personnage lui-même. Il aurait pu être fun d'avoir la possibilité de choisir d'autres personnages disposants d'un spécial différent (d'autant que la disposition de l'écran jeu n'indique pas vraiment si on est "avec" ou "contre" le personnage qui nous fait face...). Enfin quelques éléments cosmétiques à débloquer (des skins alternatifs, des pouvoirs spéciaux, des bonus...) auraient pu ajouter un plus... au moins pour qu'on ait quelque chose à faire de ces diamants. 

Bref... j'imagine que si vous êtes ultra-fan de Crypt of the Necrodancer, tout ?a vous amusera un petit temps. Mais pas s?r que ?a vous restera en tête.

game_name: The Legend of Heroes: Trails through Daybreak II
review:
This is the worst Trails game in the series, as a die hard Trails fan it pains me to leave a negative review of my favorite series.

This is the second Falcom game in a row that I'm giving a thumbs down (first being Ys Nordics). Falcom's really losing their touch. I'm really hoping their next game gets better.

? Story is just so bad because of the rewind system and so-called corrosion. The rewind system has so many unexplained issues that it simply doesn't make any sense in the story. It's clear it was just conveniently used to pad out the story. It's never explained how it's triggered and why there's no consequences for using it. Like why the hell does a NPC death trigger the rewind system? Why can it be used so repeatedly? It's been so overly used that they gave no effort to show the characters death later on and you just get a fading screen. You don't even care the main cast dying because now they have infinite lives. 

Later on in the story it's just because of corrosion this happened and because of corrosion that happened. Corrosion, corrosion and more corrosion. Then you find out most of the story turns out to be pointless.

Also it was extremely disappointing to find out who was behind C. I was expecting a lot more than that, the first 2 C's were exceptionally iconic.

Also at the end, there's just a single line that revealed that everyone automatically knew the secret meeting between Gramheart and the Grandmaster that was revealed in Reverie. Hello? Just when did this happened? How does anyone else know about the secret meeting?

? Marchen Garten was extremely disappointing. The rewards sucks and it's way worse than Reverie Corridor
? S-Craft has been seriously nerfed the way it works, you can only use it once every three turn regardless of CP. This change is simply unacceptable
? There was no epic moment or music like the Grendel fights in Daybreak 1. This was highly disappointing
? The food recipe book cannot be filled out because the last few ones require ingredients that are pretty much unobtainable

? Addition of DLSS has immensely improved graphics
? The connection event for almost everyone at the end was, dare I say, the best in the series so far
? Resume from last save is still a godsend
? Chapter boss fights were much more challenging than Daybreak 1

game_name: The Legend of Heroes: Trails through Daybreak II
review:
Play all the other games first!

I think this game has the best Gameplay and Battle System of all the Trails games.
I love that compared to "Reviere", the loading screens are nonexistent and the flow of entering and ending combat is so good, and even just entering a building feel so much better.

The Prologue went crazy and interesting, but the story in this game is not really one of the better of the series.
The characters are very good and nice tho, and it's always nice when they go back to or reference old parts of the series.

There are so many moving parts, different plots, factions, concepts and "bulls**t", that I would say that this series is way more convoluted than something like "Kingdom Hearts" lol,
But part of the fun is seeing what's gonna happen and when they bring back old characters and stuff.

The difficulty is very similar to other Trails games (I always play on hard), in that the early game is challenging enough, but the further you get in the game it just get easier and easier...

game_name: The Legend of Heroes: Trails through Daybreak II
review:
A pretty solid game overall. It doesn't compare to the masterpiece that was the first Daybreak game, but that's a high bar. I'd say I still personally enjoyed it more than the Sky or Crossbell arcs. It's main problem was the overuse of gimmicks. It felt like because they programmed a couple of minigames, they felt the need to shoehorn them in everywhere. The format was a bit unusual, but I enjoyed the expansive cast and focus on multiple threads. I think a certain plot mechanic hurt the narrative a bit because it undermined the characters' competence, but the problem was acknowledged in-world at least and they stopped just relying on it and things picked up from there.

Overall pretty easy past the first few bosses, but that's typical for me in rpgs. I'm pretty good at exploiting mechanics as soon as you give me room to work with. :X And they gave me some new toys that I abused the hell out of, as one does. Also the absolute fools learned nothing and left the shard skill for EP restore from arts, so Machine Gun Caster Agnes made a triumphant return. 

I do think the series could really use to do more complex enemy design, though. I feel like they're sort of afraid of making combat decently complex. They also discovered absorb shields recently, but have done a terrible job of balancing them. But overly powerful defensive tools that skew combat design in weird ways is a hallmark of Trails combat, so that's not really new, just a new manifestation of an old problem.

Overall, would recommend to a Trails fan. If you haven't played Trails, this is a terrible entrypoint though. Play at least Daybreak 1 first.

An incredibly low effort and lazy remastered collection that contains one fantastic game, one very good game and also The Angel of Darkness is there. I'm shocked at how poorly handled this is, yet the quality of The Last Revelation and most of Chronicles shines through. And ultimately, this is the best way to experience those games. Still, I almost wish I wasn't recommending this.

The remastered package as a whole is great, just like 1-3 Remastered, and an easy recommendation. This is the definitive way to play the classic Tomb Raider games. I really enjoyed "The Last Revelation", I think "Chronicles" was not bad, and the "Angel Of Darkness", well that's a different story.

I played the original Angel of Darkness PS2 back in 2003 and compared that this remaster is like a breath of fresh air.

I'm glad the trading system now works as it should and her movements are much more fluid.  I tried AoD from Steam complete with patches a few years ago and that doesn't compare to excellent job the developers did with this horribly flawed game.

Once I'm done with AoD I'll try Last Revelation and Chronicles

I just needed Revelations. Which after all those years was actually mediocre at best.
Tomb Raider Chronicles... I didn't remember how annoyingly bad this game was on PS1.
To resume: TR 1, 2 & 3 are excellent games (the best in the franchise), worthy of remastering. TR 4, 5 & 6 just are the worst games of the whole franchise, a mistake that should've been left forgotten.
Horrible gameplay.
Tomb Raider Chronicles is responsible for the negative review!

A really good immersive game, I became nostalgic for my adventures when I was in my 20s. The music, the vibe, the dialogs and events - everything is in place and doesn't break the narrative.
After my second playthrough it became kinda repetitive , but anyway, the first and the second runs were really good.
9/10, recommend to all RPG fans and any 35+ fellow
Macht süchtig! Cooles Game mit Liebe zum Detail

Had a  ton of fun with this game! Just let yourself drive and listen to the music. 

Fun to try to meet all of the different companions you can ride with and see which of all of the different endings you can get. There's also many different interesting encounters as well as surprisingly good little side activities like exploring on foot.

Can take a bit of trial and error in the beginning while you get a handle on the game, but not too bad at all. There's many different ways you can decide to play it out.

Would highly recommend giving it a try!

frastrated!!!!!!!!!!!! travel all over the map just to buy rally cage to join the rally race, however, the idiot ruined all my plan!!! hist level 3 trait brings me a bunch of flower, replacing my rally cage!!! why!!!! why!!!! i hate you, idiot!

Наверное это одна из самых лучших игр в которые я играл впринципе, настолько хорошо передать вайб дорожного путешествия и так красиво обьединить в нем и своего рода выживания в поиске ресурсов и постоянные дорожные потребности, и конечно же, просто ВЕЛИКОЛЕПНЫЕ истории с персонажами, я просто обожаю разработчиков, спасибо что внесли свой вклад в культуру игр, так еще и такой хороший. Аудио-визуальное соотношение в этой игре тоже заслуживает своего слова. И выполнено оно, безусловно, прекрасно, музыка в игре великолепная настолько, что я захотел добавить некоторые песни себе в плейлист а в купе с ретро стилем 80-тых и пиксильной графикой визуал получается просто бомбический.

this game was honestly very cute and fun, but it made me so motion sick for some reason-- something about the text/screen effects with a moving background made me feel ill. 
the atmosphere is incredible, and i loved the dialogue with hitchhikers, and the music! 
i would highly recommend this game for someone who wants a cute, fairly simple little "coming of age" rpg + puzzle game + inventory management game, and doesnt have similar issues that i do LOL.

This game is better than expected, and i already had good expectations! i thought i would only play a lil bit, but here i am, 6 runs in, and i'm already looking forward to my next run even though i just began the 6th one.

Pro tip: Don't skip the event on a pee break.. i feel so bad..

I really enjoyed playing this. It's a very simple and repetitive game for those who want to chill out. You level up to buy skills, match the right skill card with the pattern during a road event i.e. match orange with orange. Collect some hitchhikers to get access to more cards and complete story line quests. It's very linear and predictable with some random/procedurally generated differences from one run to the next. Get drunk or high to increase the timing and difficulty of the patterns, a lot of people seem to have difficulty with it but I think it's easy once you're in a good flow. 10/10 soundtrack. 

Don't buy this game if you like a lot of story, action and variation. Buy this game if you like puzzles, grind and atmosphere.
my first run lasted 15 minutes. i was arrested for drink driving and what looked like kidnapping a few miles from home. poggers
I feel more cozy in this game  than in real life. Amazing.

Я бы мог начать расписывать про невероятную атмосферу, медитативность геймплея, классную музыку и полученные эмоции, но я всё равно не смогу описать крутость этой игры лучше, чем Amytrip. Теперь это одна из моих любимых игр и я был бы очень рад, если бы разрабы выпустили обновления с новыми попутчиками, квестами, музыкой, концовками, машинами, картами и локализацией на других языках. Даже если они выпустят это в формате платного DLC, я всё равно куплю его и буду счастлив (кстати, было бы приятно, если бы саундтреки можно было бы купить, скачать и слушать отдельно от игры). Сразу покупайте игру, а если сомневаетесь, то просто послушайте саундтреки или посмотрите тот же обзор Amytrip'а.
game of the year

Keep Driving isn't just a game about driving; it also manages to capture a snapshot of 2000s road trip vibes. The game will immerse you in that specific era, down to the subtle details. What truly elevates this experience is its brilliant introduction of music from local Swedish indie bands, a delightful and unexpected layer that adds immense personality to the atmosphere. It can be chill, yet it manages to remain consistently engaging, making those long digital drives surprisingly captivating. The charming pixel art style and low-fidelity graphics are also great in allowing anyone to enjoy this game without needing a high-end rig. The full price is a bit high in my opinion, but with a bit of a discount during sales, Keep Driving can be a trip worth taking.
This game is great.  I can't wait to see what additional features they add to it.  And can't wait to see what updates will come out in the future.

I've only in part three, but I'm already hooked. The OST is absolutely amazing, and I love the art style in the cut-scenes, especially for the director. The cases are possible to piece together as you get more clues, and the game is easy to progress through. Story so far is super interesting, and I can't wait to figure out what it's all leading up to. 
The refresher notes for the cases are also great, noting each piece of evidence with the needed context. It's also separated into 'stages,' so it's easy to click through to find what you're looking for.

The only minor complaint I have is that a certain clue is picky about how you put the pieces together, (as in won't accept 'B and A grabbed a drink.' Must be 'A and B grabbed a drink.') But that was only for the one, and there seems to be no penalty for getting stuff wrong.

Definitely recommended for anyone who enjoys games focused on storytelling, as this is definitely a visual novel with minor game play elements. This has a very small resemblance to the point-and-click detective flash(?) games that I only half remember, but I've really never played a game like this, and it pulls you in.

10/10, will be recommending to friends.

包含剧透！透干净了！包含剧透！透干净了！包含剧透！透干净了！ 
从去年在核聚变的线下试玩过这个游戏以后我就一直很期待这个游戏。
有灵视的可爱女主角，一个神神叨叨的解决超自然事件的机构，都市传说的题材加上相当吸引我的像素风美术，可以说第一眼能看到的元素没有一个是我不感兴趣的，线下试玩的demo也停在了一个相当抓人的位置，在今年所有我期待的游戏里也是可以排在前列的。
实际通关后，虽说整体剧情和题材与我所想的确实大有出入，而且推动游戏剧情的玩法本身实际上有些……令人感到遗憾，但整个流程的氛围感确实是相当优秀，至少对我个人而言，这将近12小时流程的体验，尤其是最终15分钟给我的震撼已经可以让我感觉值回票价，甚至是为数不多的让我有冲动马上就要多买两份送给我想安利的朋友的游戏。
但不得不说的是，如果真的要完整复盘整个游戏的流程体验的话，那么通向这个最终令我大吃一惊的结局的过程很难让我说它“酣畅淋漓”。
作为一个需要去揭晓谜底的解谜游戏，我个人所认为的乐趣主要集中在两处，要么是揭晓谜底时的畅快，要么是抵达谜底的过程，而本作首先在后者做的不算好。
调查阶段的重复度过高了，高到令人烦躁。
在约12个小时，被分为6话的6个案件中，玩家所进行的流程顺序是完完全全一模一样的。前往场地前在社交网络上浏览信息搜索各种关键词，到场地后挨个和每个能对话的人对话，和每个能获得信息的物品互动，然后戴上眼镜用灵视分析每个能互动的虚影，等到信息齐全时玩一玩填字小游戏，整个游戏就是在不停地重复这一过程，就算你真的从剧情里什么都没看出来，纯一个个点过去穷举也能随意地推进剧情。
但如果谜题本身足够吸引人，那么玩法上的重复也算是小事，反倒会因为容易推进降低门槛而提高体验。
那么揭晓谜底时的畅快感呢？比较遗憾的是，也不算多。
本作剧情中的谜题设定很难称得上复杂，不如说实在是太简单了，编剧显然也不想在委托中用角色与读者信息不对称生造反转，因此实际上，每一章最新鲜的时候就只有事件开头的时候，我所能看到的信息还不多，无法进行进一步推断，事件尚且处于灵异的氛围下，这时案件对我的吸引力是最大的。
在理想状态下，我能与角色一同到达谜底自然是最好的，但这样的作品对编剧的要求似乎确实是有些高，那么哪怕稍微提前一些倒也无所谓，毕竟我比角色早那么一点能推断出真相那是我自己的本事。但本作中，除了第一话以外――用来打下本作“走近科学”的基调，因此前大半段都是超自然风格直到接近结束时才开始给有效信息――所有的案件几乎在进行到一半时（甚至有的都不到一半），我就能猜出最后的谜底是什么。但在这种前提下我依然要按部就班的去一个个和物品互动，一个个和人对话，就显得非常拖沓了。比如第三话，进入场景的那一刻我用脚想都能猜出去看相片的背面，但是不行，你必须要把所有前置的对话和调查做完才能去看相片得背面。
还好在我自己的游戏体验里有一点弥补上了这个问题，就是游戏的题材本身。
都市怪谈解体，为的是将超自然的部分抽丝剥茧露出其最本质的的部分，怪谈只是包装，解体后的现实才是真相，但主任的千里眼和女主角的灵视可是实打实的超自然力量，能看到过去的事情这件事你非让我用科学解释我就只能说都市怪谈解体中心其实是国土战略局，那个眼镜是新开发出的AR眼镜，虚影是检测出的ECHO，至于天眼锁其实是可视化的ISAC系统……显然不可能对吧。
游戏本身的像素美术也不停在展示超自然的演出，因此虽然他到最后真的是走近科学，但就因为主任与蓟本身的超自然能力，在一些案件尚未明朗时，我还是会有一层“这次不会真是超自然作祟吧”的想法在。
但哪怕这样还是掩盖不了每一个案件的流程中段显得乏味的问题，重复度太高了，高的过分，还好游戏的章节分的很明确，所以实际上我是每天完成个一话两话分了三天打完，但如果真的一次性全部打完的话，恐怕我的评价就不是“有些平淡”而是“非常无聊”了。
不过值得一提的是，本作的演出以及音乐方面倒是完全出乎我意料的好，虽然“特定”和“解体”都是重复使用的兼用卡，但每一次出现的节点都能让我兴奋起来。尤其是“解体”时使用的音乐，随着主任与蓟的问答层层渐进，保留着超自然怪谈的迷幻的同时又能给我一步步接近真相的感觉，配以天眼锁一步步解开的音效和最后充满力量的，合十的双手上下一错，主任睁开双眼，天眼锁破开后的解体二字，每一次事件最终的解体都实打实给我一种爽快感。
美中不足的可能是每一章的结尾的音乐，虽然每次插入的时机恰到好处，在剧情上也都会引出下一个爆点，但是说唱的部分作为ED的问题就是……放多了太容易审美疲劳，以至于第四话第五话时其实我都有些抵触了，虽然效果确实很不错。
而游戏的剧情，只能说确实给了我意想不到的惊喜。
首先让我没想到的是游戏对于网络环境的讨论竟然占了如此大的篇幅，如果说“走近科学”的部分其实还算是有所预料，那么对当今互联网快餐式的党同伐异的现状有如此多的讽刺则是我想都没有想过的。（很遗憾的是我甚至没法把自己从这个现象里摘出去，我自己就曾经在某些地方和某些话题里一时上头发过这种评论。）
而之后便是游戏的结局部分了。
[h1]剧透警告！[/h1]
[spoiler]有关管理员其实就是主任本人这件事其实并不难猜，在第三章或者第四章时其实就有端倪，最后一章更是同之前的流程一样，进行到一半时几乎就可以确定这件事了，直到真正的结局前，其实我多少有点认为游戏最终的走向有点落入俗套，连带着之前对互联网环境的讽刺都变得廉价了起来。
因为在2025年的今天，这种剧情真的是一丁点都不新鲜了：
一个被冤枉的人被无知的大众逼到自杀，案件被束之高阁无法侦破，真凶逍遥法外，他的兄弟或姐妹处心积虑策划多年为了变身私法制裁者揪出真凶并且向无知的民众复仇，这游戏最后一章的走向就是这样。
连续的两次解体确实在视听上让我过了把瘾，看到蓟咪在专属的BGM下与主任身份对调解开天眼锁的演出确实让我兴奋，虽然真的直接确定了主任就是管理员确实也让我觉得有些惊讶吧，但正如上文所说，早就能猜到了。
啊，之后就是主任坦白自己这么多年的心境，诉说自己的悲伤，然后世纪大和解――哦？没和解？倒计时不会停止？哎这个确实有意思，对嘛，这么多年计划的复仇，这样确实更合理，把所有人的个人信息全部传到网上进入大开盒时代也是对盲目喊大复盘的人的嘲弄，你怎么知道雪崩的时候你不是其中一片雪花呢，笑死。
你说这章有什么惊天反转？啊……倒也算吧……
然后这一切就在茉莉和蓟咪进入都市传说解体中心B4层的那一刻彻底结束了。
对啊，明明所有事件都是完全科学的，几乎没有任何超自然因素的，为什么主任和福来蓟有千里眼和灵视？
“毕竟是这个题材，有点特殊能力倒也正常，毕竟是主角嘛。”我一直是这么想的。我也往叙述性诡计的方向猜过，毕竟有两个结尾主任和蓟的对话其实不太正常，好像蓟对一些事情的反应有些太平淡了，我还猜过会不会蓟自己就是管理员，毕竟这种天真无邪的形象与前面提到的对于部分事件过于平淡的反应稍微有一些违和感――好吧，某种意义上确实猜对了，毕竟不论是管理员还是主任还是蓟他们全是同一个人。到这一刻我才明白这才是真正的大反转。
很震撼，对我而言也足够精彩。
虽然老实说，其实我反而更希望最后告诉我主任本身已经去世多年，大楼的地下4层从来没有任何东西，都只有蓟的灵视才能看到，他的存在本身就是都市传说就是了。
因为依照游戏现在的解释，将灵视当作天才的推理的话，那么有些地方其实太过生硬了，比如能准确知道高阁里的茉莉在什么地方找过东西，或是黑泽家奖杯下的保险柜密码等等，将这些全部用“天才的推理”一笔带过反而减弱了剧情的氛围，手机响起的时机这种事情就更奇怪了，倒不如直接作为超自然力量本身能说得通。毕竟游戏的整体氛围放在这里，哪怕主角就是真的有灵视也无所谓吧？
不过这也只能算是小瑕疵了，至少得知真相时的那份震撼，和我在心中疯狂为其叫好的冲动都是实打实的。[/spoiler]
我被完全骗到了，而且被骗的很开心。
开头拉蓟入职的剧情看笑了，诈骗般的话术与爱买保健品的八旬老人般的智力，先给个差评。后续看剧情决定要不要改好评

I took my time with this game, exploring the quest lines, developing my own mages, and trying to max out misc aspects. This game can easily be enjoyed on a first playthrough or a 11th playthrough and still offer enough content each time. If you enjoy colony sims, this game will be right up you alley.

The characters are awesome too~ the detail into races, and magic types, and combos. It makes figuring out your strategy with each battle a fun experience. 
If you're into games where your build stuff and constantly adapt to new environments, plus some pretty cool animation, you gotta play this!

A inova??o no modo história (porque é só oque tem) foi boa, andando pelo mapa e conhecendo os herois de acordo com as circunstancias (batalhas e eventos). Todavia o mapa é mal aproveitando ficando vago e e sem uso já que n?o acontece quase nada RELEVANTE e que de FATO fosse mudar alguma coisa na história ou descobrir personagens secretos. O máximo que acontece s?o uma batalhas aleatórias (bandidos) que , como dito antes n?o possuem grande impacto, no máximo uns itens. Por outro lado, da pra se aprofundar mais ainda na personalidade de cada personagem.

Falando em personagens, s?o um saco, praticamente todos, falei TODOS os personagens s?o apaixonados pelo lord/senhor, defendendo comportamentos sem lógica de outros personagens pra justificar por exemplo porque tal personagem é um grande filho da p*t@. Se era pra ter tanto aprofundamento na história ent?o que aprofundasse a personalidade dos personagens em de serem todos fanáticos pelos seus senhores.

??????????Title: Dynasty Warriors: Origins - Button-Mashing Fun with a Side of Amnesia.???? ??????

Dynasty Warriors has been around so long it’s practically a classic, and just when you thought it couldn’t get any crazier, we’ve got *Dynasty Warriors: Origins*. In this game, you take on the role of a nameless warrior who can’t remember anything. Because honestly, what’s more heroic than jumping into battle without a clue as to why you’re swinging that sword?

The story is a classic case of “I don’t know who I am, but I can totally smash through enemies!” You play as the Wanderer, a guy who’s forgotten everything except how to turn armies into a mess. Your mission? To figure out who you really are, which feels a little too familiar for anyone who has ever lost track of their car keys in a big parking lot.

The graphics have definitely gotten a facelift. Enemies don’t just suddenly show up―they now pop out in glorious 4K. And there are loads of them charging right at you! But don’t worry; your sword is so massive it feels like it should come with its own warning label.

When it comes to combat, this is where the game really shines. You have light attacks, heavy attacks, and Musou attacks―which I can only describe as “did you seriously just wipe everything off the screen?” It’s like Photoshop’s eraser got angry. There are some counter moves which add a bit of strategy, but let’s be real―a lot of us are still just mashing buttons like they owe us money.

The tactical bits are a nice touch. You can tell your troops what to do, which makes you feel like a real commander. That is, f they didn’t sometimes make decisions that are about as smart as a sack of flour.

But hey, it’s not all perfect. The game’s AI can get a little wild and decide that running straight into enemy spears is a solid tactic. While the Wanderer is off trying to piece together his identity, your troops seem to be on a quest for self-sabotage.

Still, there’s something super satisfying about *Origins*. It’s like comfort food for gamers―a chaotic but warm blanket where you can dive into battle, forget your worries, and take out hundreds of enemies in one big swing.

Dynasty Warriors: Origins is like a can of stress relief. If you love some good old button-mashing, epic fights, and a main character who can’t remember anything except how to cause chaos, this game is for you. Grab that sword, leave your worries behind, and get ready to conquer the battlefield... and your own memory loss.

I really loved this game. The gameplay is phenomenal, the expansion of the story is great, albeit confusing for anyone who hasn't played the original FF7 and for me: Crisis Core. There was a lot of stuff in the story that I picked up on, and a lot that flew right over my head. The pacing is a bit bloated with there not being stopping points between long extended sequences. The game is great, but feels overbloated. After about 70 hrs, I felt like I wanted the story to wrap up, not because I didn't like it, but I feel like games nowadays feel a need to give so many play hours so that gamers with a lot of free time on their hands don't feel like they are wasting their time. As a full time student, I came in and out, this game was a bit of struggle with my relationship with my gf as well, since I would get sucked in and time blindness sunk in. I like that the franchise has moved to more Kingdom Hearts style gameplay and my god, it's so good. Also, really a nice showcase for my RX 9070 XT.

下一个最新版的FFVIIHook，把压缩包里面的两个文件，分别放到安装路径和存档路径下面。

编辑Engine.ini添加以下参数：
r.DynamicRes.OperationMode=0
r.DynamicRes.MinScreenPercentage=100
r.TemporalAASamples=32
r.MotionBlurQuality=0
r.Shadow.MaxResolution=4096
r.Shadow.CSM.TransitionScale=2

前面两行关掉动态分辨率，中间两行改善场景模糊，后面两行改善角色模糊。GTX3070+2014年的处理器i7-4790K，1080p60pfs显示器开3840×2160+TAAU+120fps用窗口模式显示，如果上面有白边就按Alt+回车后再按Alt+回车切换两次即可。

It's been a long time since I played something this dull.

The locations are terrible, just endless rocks and scrap metal with constant crashing sounds from barrels and crates and that dumb, never-ending music. The character moves over them like a car without suspension, and the camera shakes like it's being held by a drunk.

We’re endlessly pushing around some slow nonsense, vacuums, minecarts. Сrawling up walls so sluggishly it makes you not even want to go for that chest.

Chadley is driving me nuts with his calls. Can I just throw this fantasy smartphone away? Send a text, why are you calling?!

The combat is a mess. Everything sparkles, enemies don’t even fit on the screen, and the camera swings around like it’s lost. All anyone does is get their ass kicked while you run around building up a gauge just to use a healing spell.

So far, I haven’t seen a single thing done well.

[ STEAM DECK REVIEW ]

I really wanted to enjoy Final Fantasy VII Rebirth on the Steam Deck, but the experience is disappointing. The visuals are heavily blurred, full of graphical artifacts, and lighting is often overwhelmingly bright. Framerate stays around 25 FPS and rarely hits a stable 30. Even on the lowest settings, performance is poor. It's unfortunate that a game of this scale isn't properly optimized for handheld play. Needs a major patch before it can be recommended.

Score: 4/10

This is a game I love and hate at the same time. The game that has the best and the worst gameplay decisions ever at the same time.

The combat in itself is a really great evolution from Remake. They solved a lot of issues and managed to keep the characters' own combat styles. Other than some bosses with BS mechanics and the more than one-hour-long last boss fight, I would say it is great. (Yes, you heard me right. It has so many cutscenes and phases that it takes more than an hour to beat it on normal difficulty.)

My biggest nitpick is that the game still has no DMR for CCs, so you can get stuck in a CC loop until the end of combat. The solution: use one of the few inventory slots you have for a protection item for that specific fight instead of an item that is important for your build. They really need to fix this issue in the next game.

They made the game world huge and added a lot of things to do in it while making exploration and side activities fun and useful since you gain actual power and relationship points while doing them.

But not all is good. The game is plagued by minigames―terrible ones that are designed in a way to let the AI cheat. They have mechanics that are in place so that if the player is winning, the game starts to push back. The worst offenders for this are the 3D brawler and Queen's Blood. And no, minigames are not just side activities. The main quests are filled with them, including a Queen's Blood tournament.

So what's good about this game, then? Well, the story and the characters. The writing is great, the characters have actual depth and good dialogues. The only problem is that it is the second game of the trilogy, so I still have no clue what the hell Sephiroth really wants to achieve, and then there's the whole multiverse thing... confusing as hell.

The Japanese voice actors are amazing, including the huge number of side characters, each with their own unique voice, so I feel like they kinda employed the whole Japanese VA industry for this game. Though sadly, for the Aerith song part, they did not use her voice, Maaya Sakamoto, who has a proven track record of being a great singer―neither the English VA. They used a third person to sing in English only. Really immersion-breaking.

Talking about immersion-breaking, the translation is terrible. Even if you just have anime-watcher knowledge of Japanese, you will hear the tons of mistranslations. Many times, what the Japanese voice says and what the subtitles say is a completely different thing.

The music, though, is amazing. Just next level. The same goes for the visuals―the game, the characters, everything looks amazing.

Overall, this is a really great game, plagued by terrible minigames and a terrible translation.
[b]10/9[/b]

Great game that's a lot of fun to play. Unfortunately, as of the time of this comment, this port of the game in particular is very unstable. I upgraded my pc specifically to play it, and it unfortunately crashes very often despite my pc being more than capable of running a game this huge and demanding. Occasionally, it wouldn't be just the game that crashes, my entire pc would crash as well. To the point where I feared the game wasn't just frustrating to play, but harmful to my pc's health in general. 

I've heard some pc builds don't run into this problem as often as others. With the working theory I've read being that some pc builds are probably closer to the pc's that were used to port the game in the first place. So if you're still really determined to play this game on pc no matter what, in spite of the crashes, I recommend at least doing some research before hand. To find out if you need to install some performance mods/ lower some settings to avoid the crashes as best you can. 

If you read nothing else from this comment, let me summarize everything I just said into two sentences. 

The game is poorly optimized for pc, it crashes often regardless of specs. If you own a Ps5, try playing it there instead.
FF7 Repeakbirth
Absolute Masterpiece
peak

Truely a masterpiece, remakes seldomly are capable of recapturing the feelings of their original, not only has this game done so, it has surpassed it. During a time where gaming companies are just pushing trash out, Square Enix gives me hope. I loved FF7 Remake, and FF7 Rebirth has gone to the next level. exploration is next level and fun, nothing felt like a chore, you actually want to complete everything (except the golden saucer 8 bit boxing, that can kiss my ass). Story line gives you more questions than answers but not in an annoying way, which is rare. Its made me even more excited for the third and final one. First play through took 113 hours and i didnt even beat everything. Top tier game.

The gameplay is unique and simply amazing, the story - at the end of the day is basically exactly what it was in the original just with better delivery via voice acting and fleshed out story arcs and character interactions. all of the stuff with the ending does not really change anything for the plot. so far. it just allows breathing room for characters to interact. the pacing - if you want to just experience the main story is good. if you want to complete everything it can be a bit jarring with how much content you unlock the moment you enter a new region but the zones are so beautiful i found myself naturally running into most objectives. the fleshed out story in the cosmo canyon region was superb and my personal favorite part. i would recommend this to anyone that isnt going to be upset that the game isn't turn based anymore and wouldnt consider extended character interactions and fleshed out story to be "filler" (???)

Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 is an action-adventure video game released in 2023 for the PlayStation 5, developed by Insomniac Games. It continues the story of Peter Parker and Miles Morales as they team up to protect New York City from powerful new threats. The game introduces Kraven the Hunter, who arrives in the city with an army to hunt superpowered beings, and Venom, a monstrous transformation of Peter after he bonds with the alien symbiote. As Peter struggles with the symbiote's dark influence, Miles takes on more responsibility, and the two Spider-Men must work together to stop chaos from spreading. The game features fast-paced combat, upgraded abilities, and seamless web-swinging across a larger, more detailed open-world version of New York City, including new areas like Queens and Brooklyn.

So... Rtx 3060, all other specs above minimum or recommanded. I run remastered and miles morales perfectly fine, and then this one, Marvel's Spider-Man 2... basically, it's so bad it's hilarious. Characters randomly T pose in cutscenes, when I had the chance of seeing one, etc. unplayable. After a bit of research, I found out you need to delete 2 files, I did it and then it was way better, I got nice fps, I could play and even have fun, BUT, the map was loading everytime I was moving too much. So impossible to swing acrosse the city whitout having the game freezing to load. After more research, some people adviced to move the game on SSD, I did and now it's perfect. I can play the game, it runs smoothly and it's beautiful. Seriously, this game looks so much better than the first one. And the movements are so cool. But yeah, if you want to enjoy the game, you need enough storage on SSD and to delete 2 files from the game folder. That's not normal, and I never saw these issues with other games. Months after release on pc, yeah, I understand why players are upset. Im lucky because Im patient, I could have refund earlier but Im glad I didnt.

[h1] Assetto Corsa Evo C What's the Point of This Game? [/h1]

At this rate, it’ll probably take 3+ years before this even releases and there seems to be no clear vision for what this game is supposed to be. iRacing already exists for those who want a competitive and realistic online racing experience, and it does it far better in any concivable way. Singleplayer racing is not an option since AI is simply imported from original AC without any noticeable improvements and rams into you at any chance it gets.

[b] This game should’ve leaned into what the original Assetto Corsa community actually uses it for: [/b]
An open-world driving sandbox with AI traffic
Free-roam cruising / drifting / no hesi etc.

Instead of giving people what they want we get this generic racing sim which excels at nothing and outperformed by many competitors - or even other AC games.

Next release will add Spa circuit which has been laser scanned to every single racing sim ever existed so try to imagine my boundless excitement for that. Yeah, truly groundbreaking stuff…

[h3] AI & Driving Experience[/h3]
If you’ve raced with AI in the original Assetto Corsa, you already know how terrible it was. Nothing has changed here.
[list]
    [*]The AI is still clueless ― no spatial awareness, rams into you constantly.
    [*]Brakes in the most absurd places - sometimes even on straights.
    [*]GT Cars: Handle noticeably worse than in Assetto Corsa Competizione.
    [*]Road Cars: Feel almost identical to the original Assetto Corsa ― no meaningful evolution in driving physics.
[/list]

The only major upgrade seems to be graphics, which are:
[list]
 [*]Causing massive performance issues for most people
 [*]Not worth the trade-off if the rest of the game isn’t evolving
 [*]Modded AC still looks much better so what is even the point?
[/list]

Right now, this game feels like a confused product:
[list]
 [*]It does not satisfy the AC free-roam crowd since nothing they want is there and won't be added for a very long time.
 [*]It does not satisfy people who want to race in Singleplayer/Career since AI is horrible.
 [*]Online racing will never surpass iRacing when it's finally added so no luck there too.
[/list] 

What’s the point of this game? That remains a mystery. Who asked for this game? That also remains a mystery.

While there's been a handful of attempts to do something a bit like Animal Crossing on PC, this game manages to do it in a way that actually even rivals that franchise.  A very structurally sound game in both gameplay and technical stability that allows it to even run flawlessly on Linux with Proton.  There's lots of exploring, progression, and story that will have you playing for a little bit every day, and the devs have recently made some great QOL changes specific for the PC version to reduce a bit of the FOMO material collecting that was there to encourage Apple Arcade players to log in daily since this is a one-time purchase with as of current no microtransactions or paid DLC.  Even if you're not a Sanrio fan if you're looking for a chill casual life/exploration game this may be worth a shot for you still.

For Animal Crossing fans looking for a lighter, more casual experience, Hello Kitty's Adventure offers a simpler alternative. While both games feature cute, colourful worlds and stress-free game play, Hello Kitty's Adventure is much more straightforward, focusing on simple quests and exploration. Unlike Animal Crossing, which offers deep customisation, long-term progression, and dynamic interactions with villagers, Hello Kitty’s Adventure is more linear and lacks the depth and freedom that Animal Crossing is known for. If you enjoy creative freedom and gradual development, Hello Kitty’s Adventure might feel a bit too basic and repetitive, but it’s a great choice for a quick, relaxing escape.

i’ve played 24 hours of hello kitty island adventure, and i can say this with my whole heart: this game is peak. i went in expecting a cozy, lighthearted experience―but what i got was something much more magical.

just when i thought i had seen everything the map had to offer, i stumbled into a completely new area i hadn’t noticed before. it gave me that same feeling i had in elden ring―you know, when you take that one long elevator ride and suddenly realize the map is way bigger than you thought. absolutely amazing.

i’ll say it again: this game is peak.

A return to form sprinkled with some modern QOL elements. I can see that they spent some time creating lore to carry the story along, but unfortunately for me it is the weakest part of the game as it never really pulled me in and had me invested in the characters or conflicts. The format/style that was chosen to tell the story of your climb to the top feels fluffed with irrelevant tangent backgrounds to characters that have no true anchor to the story or plot. Even though I am personally not the biggest fan of how the story plays out, I am a huge fan on the game play, which I can only assume is what brought us ALL here. For anyone that has played previous titles in the series, it's business as usual in the best way possible. The game loop is not a chore to grind as BP and CP come fairly easy which left me constantly saying "Just one more race". I can't wait to see the upcoming content that has yet to be released through the early access. I hope they bring back some of the little things like interiors with the charm hanging from the rearview, as well as introduce some new elements to keep it fresh and a expand the series, but not by following the trend of the gaming industry (From what I can tell there is no worry of that!). I know I'm excited about a game when it has me thinking of mechanics and elements to add, not because it is lacking or needs it, but because I can see all the potential ways this series can continue to expand and grow.

I was going to make this review when I had around 15 minutes in this game because I knew I was right, but I didn’t want to sacrifice my journalistic integrity by having people look at how little time I had put into the game and dismiss my opinions out of hand.

This game is an unarguable upgrade from the first. The art is vastly improved due to it looking more detailed and having the various foliage, like tree leaves, grass, and flowers, rock back and forth with the wind. The stats of the starting hero (I played a wizard in both the first game and this one, and the mana you start with in this game is around 5 or 6x what you start with in the original) are boosted a lot compared to a hero from the first game, even from level 1. Even as a squishy wizard, I started with around a hundred health, which is around triple what I started with in the first game.

Let’s look at what this game has that the first doesn’t. First, this game has more open areas. The first area of this game is a forest. The first area in the original is a mine. Then a prison. Then an abandoned castle. It’s very boxy and enclosed. There’s a lot more maneuverability available to the player if the landscape is more open to kite squads of enemies. You still can do that in the first game but it was a lot more difficult. In order for you, in the first game, to have the size of the floors you do in this game, you would have to pick the ‘Expanded Floors’ positive boon in the hub area’s fountain. Positive boons, if not balanced out with negative boons, cost gold. You have to pay in-game currency you acquire from past runs to make the game have more content. The floors in this game are so so much larger by default. I appreciate that.

Something else that is not present in the first is the ability to find mercenaries within the stages of the game. Occasionally you can run into wayward warriors sitting on logs within the forest, and you can recruit them as allies to fight for you. In the original, I only was ever able to play as myself. Maybe some class has an ability to summon a pet, but the ability to recruit random allies is class unspecific and everyone has the chance to run into it.

The acquisition of ore has been replaced with finding new materials, like wooden boards and other materials to build new buildings within the game’s hub base. Additionally, you can also find trinkets such as bronze tankards, chalices, and other shiny valuables that add up to a good chunk of gold. These changes come with resurrection costing gold, but considering the fact that death in the first game meant you lost everything you didn’t transfer before dying, this is a fine change to me.

The first game is not bad, but it does have a bit of jank to it. Depending on what hero you play, it could be more or less interesting to play the beginning hours of it. People complaining about this game having a repetitive start have no idea what it feels like to go and gather ore in the mines. You go to work in the mines. The children yearn for the mines. I’m pretty sure all runs start with you going through the mines, unless you pass the red portal hypercube shortcut trial every new run to skip to the next area.

The system where you level up different stats and skills is mostly unchanged from the original, but you do start with a third skill instead of just two. You still need to level up to acquire the stars you need to boost your skills and unlock new ones, but you can also put individual points into stats like Intelligence or Vitality to influence your character’s growth further.

Calling this game a cash grab is an insane statement to me. You don’t know how much better this game feels to play and you don’t know the definitions of the words you are speaking. This is a good product that improves upon its predecessor and knew where it needed to upgrade itself. I dunno what to say other than that. If you don’t like this game, then you’ll absolutely despise the first. Maybe the lower ratings are because more people that didn’t play the original are being exposed to this game and are basing their judgments on their sole experience with this game alone, but I would still say it holds up as a first experience. I remember being blown away by the first game, so either I’m simple-minded or everyone else’s expectations are too high. Then again, I commonly play Morrowind and Disgaea, so maybe I’m more uniquely suited to jank and repetition.

A very fun medieval town builder, with some glaring issues.

-Poor tutorial that doesn't explain a ton of mechanics like attaching building parts properly, undesirable areas, etc.
-Not the greatest performance (requires playing on medium settings on a 9800X3D / RTX 3070 PC).
-Has bugs (example: sometimes when assigning villagers to a job the window will constantly close).
-Other major annoyances like moving buildings should be free but instead it costs a lot of resources, or adding a gate to wall is an absolute nightmare.

These major issues hold Foundation back from greatness. It's probably an 7.5/10 when it could easily be a 9/10 or higher.

Easily my favorite game. I always wanted a game that had resource management, production, and city building BUT also had designing and custom building aspect with those resources. Games like Factorio, were my favorite but i always felt like i couldnt do the things i wanted with the resources after i perfected my production. Like "ok great I have everything working perfect and automated and optimal, but now i want to build a city or something with it. Then there were some games that had the city building with some resource management like City skylines or planet coaster which let you do very detailed designing but the resource management was really money and keeping up some sort of happiness factor. I always wanted one that let me do both and this game has it perfected for me. I already put in 60 hours before i realised that its still in 1.10 haha. I really hope the devs stick to this game and keep working hard. I look forward to seeing future new buildings, resources and decoration and building a more detailed automated self-sustaining city. To top it all off they already have mod integration. I might take a stab at doing some heavily detailed mods designed for adding tech trees that go beyond the iron-age world the game is set in. Overall, a great experience and while there are plenty and I mean plenty of things that need to be ironed out or adjusted, its simple stuff that you would expect from a 1.10 and I am sure itll be fixed soon. there are already some mods that fix or add some things.

It's fantastic. Been yearning for something like this for ages, since Settlers 6. Later Settlers weren't the same. Manor Lords is a good idea, but not nowhere near as streamlined as this.  There's Dawn of Man, but it's not really all that fun. There's Cities XL, but that's something else than this.

It's the best casual addictive city builder I've tried to date.
Has that constant progression, that feels rewarding. And a challenge to manage well.

Cons:
There's some tiny glitches, that need to be smoothed out. Nothing major, barely worth mentioning.
Lacks some QoL here and there, to mitigate micro management and looking for needles in a haystack.
The performance... GPU usage is through the roof. Shadows and GI especially. It's just atrocious, for what you're seeing on screen. Had to turn off shadows and GI entirely, to maintain 117 fps @ 3440x1440, on a 5070 Ti.
It`s a relaxing city builder. I like it. The game could use a bit of polish, but considering the price, you get a lot of value for your money.

The game is fun but devs are non-responsive on issues they don't want to work on. The UI for several resolutions has been broken since the game came out into 1.0 and devs have either refused to respond or in my case when I emailed tech support about the issue told me "you must have something open blocking it" (I didn't, literally all I'd had open at time of playing was the game itself). If you're thinking of playing this game I hope you like playing on 1600x900 and ONLY that resolution if you want to be able to interact with everything. I did genuinely enjoy this game but until the UI issues are fixed and I can play at my native UI instead of having to stare at a tiny blurry resolution not fit for my screen I cannot recommend this game. IF the devs ever actually fix the issues people are reporting then this review may change.

Alors, ce qui est sur c’est que le jeu est bien, on ne s’ennuie pas du tout les mécanismes sont toujours aussi agréables, on peut choisir d’être en infiltration ce qui offre comme sur les autres sniper élite un gameplay sympa en évitant à tout prix de se faire repérer et que l’alarme ne soit pas déclenchée.
Mais achetez le seulement si vous aimez les sniper élite. Sniper élite résistance est en fait le même jeu que sniper élite 5 mais avec de nouvelles cartes ( les cartes sont classiques (je suis à la moitié du jeu) surtout que la carte du barrage est utilisé 2 fois, aucune ne dépasse la meilleur carte a mon humble avis en l’occurrence ??chateau de beauregard?? (Sniper élite 5). Sinon, évidemment, on s’amuse bien les cartes sont quand même assez diversifiées (Sabotage des Sonderzüge assez sympa comme carte environnement urbain de nuit, mortelle contre attaque pas mal non plus (forte inspiration d’un des dlc de sniper élite 4 et d’une des carte de sniper élite 4 ) c’est bien mais bon niveau originalité… la fosse du diable plus décevante à mon go?t elle ressemble beaucoup à une des cartes de sniper élite 5 dans un environnement de basse montagne de nuit en plein air, je trouve que ce type de carte manque de lisibilité. En fait, le seul défaut de ce jeu c’est qu’il stagne, pas de nouveautés, le jeu reste sur les acquis de sniper élite 5. Ainsi, 15/20 semble assez justifié pour quelqu’un qui aime la franchise et qui aime les mécanisme d’infiltration… mais après par rapport à sniper élite 5 on pourrait être dé?u est mettre pas plus de 11-12/20.

Space Engineers 2 delivers a remarkable leap forward in space-building sandbox games, offering an intuitive and accessible building experience that even newcomers can quickly grasp. The new grid system and automatic build symmetry feature significantly simplify ship design, allowing players to create and pilot their own ships with ease within just an hour of gameplay. Performance is solid, running smoothly at high settings with minimal frame drops even during intense destruction sequences.

The game shines as a sturdy creative sandbox, where the joy of constructing and crashing ships recalls the playful spirit of childhood Lego battles. The building mechanics are surprisingly snappy and intuitive, supported by helpful features like precise block alignment, symmetry planes, and blueprint creation. Although still in early access and lacking survival elements, the core gameplay foundation is strong and promising for future updates.

Overall, Space Engineers 2 offers a polished and engaging creative playground with excellent potential to become the definitive space engineering game. It’s an exciting start that invites both veterans and new players to explore, build, and experiment in a beautifully realized space environment.

The dollar signs come after the numbers instead of before. I can't recommend something that encourages incorrect grammar.

Other complaints: Basic flashlights should be free alongside the basic cameras. Having to pay $500 for a flashlight is absolutely brutal when your team also needs med kits. Not restoring health at the end of a round is also dumb.

Most of the items are too expensive for what they're worth. It's the same problem as repo. Have 1 bad round and get absolutely screwed for the rest of the run.

Can't recommend until there's a major balance pass on item costs, or if the items get way more useful than they are for their price points.

They also reduced how much money you get pretty significantly. Playing with 4 players on stage 2.5 when the goal goes up to $4,000 was a complete joke. Most of the shots were considered duplicates but there wasn't enough enemy variety to get non-duplicates, and the multipliers for what you could get were extremely low even on great shots.

Although I get the non-combat angle of playing as a press member, I feel like it would be good if it was possible to purchase weapons. Sometimes a bunch of the same enemy spawns in an area and there's just not much you can do, and there's no reward for snapping photos of them since they're all duplicates and contribute nothing to your score.

PSA: There are hackers in this game ... it is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED that you play this game offline or in private only matches.

This game is fun but unless the devs implement a way to ban the hackers from this game it's recommended that you play in private matches and invite players you trust to play with you.

There is a user who joins your lobby and hacks by spawning plenty of items that kill other players such as mines etc.

This game is worth playing but after encountering these types of players it's not worth playing in public lobbies.

If you do end up playing with randoms, just be aware that you will enter a lobby with a high risk of a cheater in your game and ruining your gaming experience.

- Beaucoup de nouveaux monstres facilement 5 comme : King Kong, de nouveaux aliens, un nouveau Gros boss avec un Méga Laser ! Et de nouvelles variantes de montres (de ce que j'ai vu dans ma session)
- Nouveaux items comme le système de ce soigné avec un medkit, fusée, trampoline, clé de désamor?age de mine, nouvel appareil photo ?
- Nouvelle map : San Francisco (de ce que j'ai vu de ma session encore une fois)
- Qualité graphique (meilleure) j'ai l'impression
- La suppression des photos ! Pour pouvoir en refaire de meilleur qualité avec un meilleur score ! Car le jeu est beaucoup plus dur forcément ?a va de soi avec cette mise à jour ! Bref je fait ce jeu avec un ami à 2 et c'est vraiment des moments de barre !
- Découverte d'un Cherrif Us Army pas trop friendly à des moments lol.. Je vous laisse découvrir ?a en jeu !
- Carte de presse : possibilité d'en racheter 3 pour (6.500 dollars)


Le seul bémole, c'est que l'on peut plus cumuler comme à l'époque les scores jusqu'à perdre les trois cartes de presse, maintenant, il faut tout faire d'un coup ! ?a change quand même pas mal la donne effectivement.

Great game concept , incredibly fun with friends.


Pros :
-Fun factor is way up there, especially with friends.
-The devs keep working on it and that is always a good sign for future QOL content.
-You can laugh at your own death instead of screaming or crying.
-KISS : Keep it simple Stupid, take pictures, the more daring or self-destructive the better.
-With all the new mechanics in place, your pics , you surviving or your demise as an impact.

Cons :
-Like any games of the genre, you might get bored of the repetition.
 But then again, when i see players on DBD for over 5k hours, i dont really care
 if they call it 'repetitive' lol
-Can be janky at times, while this is a con, it is also a source of funny deaths
 or hilarious moments.
-Some items still need a lil work, but nothing time cant fix.
-Photo Duplicates, that is really the only gripe i got , the game is sometimes very
 arbitrary on what it considers duplicate photos, however, you can now erase
 said duplicates to retake a shot.
-RNG Factor : while i always had very bad luck , walking around outside or in buildings
 to either stumble on a horde of mobs or nothing is sometimes too few and far between.
 Sure, you can modify some of the rules in custom lobbies , bu it needs just a tad more stability.


All in all , amazing game where you will have your fun and wont need to worry (for once) about meta
building, optimising your gameplay...You just go head on and take pictures like your life depends on it.
It does what other games (i wont mention, you know which ones) fail to do , this game
needs no mods or third party additions, it simply works as is.You know a game is good
when you dont need a crutch to enjoy it.For those doubting, give it a try with mates , but
for it's price and the fun I had, well worth it so far and even if it stopped tomorrow, i played
more on this game than most AAA out there and for a quarter of the price.

Neat idea, and was fun with friends before the latest update, but this update has been a step backwards and feels more like Early access in its current state. The camera detects duplicate photos constantly even when it is clearly not a duplicate and it doesn't actually count towards your score now if it thinks it's a duplicate photo, which was very annoying to play with, and actually turns this game into a grind and kills the fun out of it, not to mention that this game is really only playable with a party of at least 3 people, but single to 2 players will really have to grind and not be trying to have fun. Will change my review if either the duplicate photos are changed to either count or are patched to actually detect a duplicate photo. (Also side request make sewers not 1 hit kill because that's even more frustrating and not even remotely scary.)

Entrei em The Headliners achando que seria um simples simulador de fotojornalismo. Logo percebi que estava mais para um estágio intensivo de sobrevivência em zona de guerra.

Primeira miss?o: eu e meus colegas jornalistas, armados apenas com cameras, adentramos uma Nova York devastada. Nos deparamos com um "Velociralien" ― imagine um cruzamento entre Godzilla e um T-Rex faminto. Enquanto tentávamos capturar a foto perfeita, um tornado com olhos vermelhos (sim, olhos!) surgiu do nada, sugando carros, postes e um dos nossos colegas.

No meio do caos, outro membro da equipe decidiu que seria uma boa ideia posar para uma selfie com um alienígena ao fundo. Resultado: foto borrada e mais um colega perdido.

Nota: 10/10. Transformou meu conceito de "trabalho em equipe" e "perigo iminente". Recomendo para quem acha que sua profiss?o é estressante.
it's very fun and exiting your heartrate goes way up!

Local Hyper Light Drifter addict here to tell you that this is a mostly great game. I may include spoilers.

It's basically the same thing that happened with Risk or Rain 2. From 2d to 3d, keeping many of the things that made the first game great while changing/adding/removing things in a way that makes it truly feel like a sequel. 
The biggest change is that it's now a rogue-like and can be played with friends. Other than that it really just feels like the first game with the addition of another angle and parrying.
The parrying is tough. I definitely have a very difficult time judging when I should hit the parry button with each enemy I encounter. I honestly don't like it very much but there are times when it feels amazing, like when parrying dog boss. I usually resort to just trying to be even better with my dashing, as that was a core mechanic of the first game. 
On dashing, I haven't gotten to the final upgrade for it but it feels good. It doesn't allow you to do crazy dashes immediately, and it looks less impactful (to be expected when changing visual mediums), but it's good nonetheless. 
My pacing is pretty bad as I'm just throwing paragraphs in a stream of consciousness as I think of them.
In combat I personally opt for the light and medium weapons because the heavies feel way too slow for most situations. By the time I have swung on 1 or 2 dudes in a group, some variation of a dashing/shooting enemy hits me while I am in my attack or recover animations and thusly can't do anything about it. If you have a decent gun to take care of those guys before you are swinging on other guys it can be alright, but it's a rogue-like, so that isn't always the case. I just opt for the chad daggers or claws and go crazy doing cool dash attacks. Those are important; don't forget to use the dash attacks frequently. Alx Preston doesn't want you to know this but ammo is free. You can dash attack enemies into stagger to execute them and they can drop ammo canisters. I have 458 ammo canisters.
For the guns. The guns are pretty ok. I quite like the scattergun and all of the pistols. rifles rarely drop for me so I don't have too much of an opinion and the smg just isn't my style. That Diamond Shot is pretty interesting. Fun against a lot of small dudes.
Leveling is fine. I liked that the first game didn't have levels but for how the world levels up and the game is more of a rogue-like I don't mind it. Upgrading weapons and unlocking characters levels/perks is cool. I got all of my perks for free because for some reason it just let me buy them all in one go without spending the resources. It's still early access so I'm not that surprised. 
I think that mostly covers the mechanics of the game. The world itself is amazing. The first game felt very defined. The music has a particular and unique sound; all of the sounds of the game do, in fact. The color schemes and state of the world are blended in a way that I'm not smart enough to explain but if I could would dive into a 2 hour essay bro style of sperging. I really really like the world of HLD/HLB. It has such a specific style that you can feel as you explore the worlds of both games. Shout out to Disasterpeace; what an incredible musician. 

I've been writing a while so I think I can stop there. There's a lot more that I could talk about but if you've been reading this far and haven't bought it yet it's probably not for you. If you already own the game and are reading this just because, want to run a round or 2? Hit me up on on here.

作为一个动作游戏的新人，游戏前期体验有些难顶。虽然刚进游戏有了基本操作的指引，但是正式进入开放世界之后发现怪物强度跟教学完全不在一个水平，一些有特殊技能怪物，比如会把我顶飞的乌龟，希望制作组可以在第一次遇见的时候，提供一个简单的介绍，告诉我他的基本技能和应对方法。另外地图上的回血草过于稀疏并且数值离谱，回复针又过于昂贵，给开荒带来巨大压力。
总结来说，游戏的画面和武器打击感在线，但是难度设置和新人指引有待优化，单人开荒实属坐大牢。期待后续更新！

I really liked the game on my first playing during early access. I thought it was incredibly challenging, and I kept dying at first. Then I learned, got better, and started to be able to kill bosses and clear some cycles. I did like the initial changes to the medkit system because I felt starting off without any medkits just because you happened to end a run using them on the last boss was a little annoying and incentivized you to go in to just get medkits on your first extract and go back in.

I got to a point where I put together a great build I could take through runs and have some fun with specific holobytes and breakers.

I stopped playing for a while just cause I got tired of only fighting two bosses (wolf and gladiator dude), but saw the new update had the new boss and a lot of changes and came back into it.

Enemies feel weaker and therefore each hit is let punishing. It doesn't feel satisfying to win because there's hardly a challenge anymore. There no risk of dying on extracts until the end when you face enemies. I fought the new boss for the first time on my last run, and I didn't have to use a single medkit even without knowing its mechanics going in.

I understand holding onto the holobytes that stack could make them too powerful, but also only having holobytes and equipment stay around for one run makes it almost impossible to have a specific build for rails, blades, or statuses.

A lot of the changes just feel unecessary and I don't particularly understand the reasoning behind changing the difficulty to what feels like much easier.

TLDR; Feels like game got too easy and you can't keep things across runs to try and make specific builds.

Big No with the way it goes! because no more stash or shop and way too limited loot to get any build set up to feel good. taking away rogue like elemtens from a rogue like and turning them into useless ressource farming for nearly nonexisting metaprogression options. still an annoying time based difficulty progession without any way of pausing exept extraction, instead of a PoI clear progression based difficulty. so many steps back instead of forward. people just want to have fun you know... and your base combat gameplay alone sadly is not the quality to make this fun.

While the game is in early access, it is already a very fun roguelike experience with smooth combat and fun exploration. Unlike many other early access games, the devs are very much willing to listen to the community and implement changes based on feedback. I wish only the best to Heart Machine as they continue to work on this fantastic game.

Проснулся в понедельник, сел на мопед, поехал в город, в 10 метров от дома слегка задел обочину, упал, быстро поднялся, завел мопед и поехал, через 2 метра поздоровался с деревом и умер, проснулся уже в городе. Начал искать дорогу домой, в полях встретил брата, который любезно согласился меня подвезти, перепутал кнопки среднего и большого пальца, после чего братишка обиделся и решил намотать нас на дерево, после я снова проснулся в городе, решил доехать на автобусе, даже вышел в нужном месте, пошел домой и умер от жажды спустя сотню метров. После очередного пробуждения в городе, купил ящик пива и пошел домой пешком. Ночью вторника я был дома, с радостью сохранился и лег спать. Утро началось со стука в дверь, в гости попросились полицейские, после того, как я открыл дверь меня повязали и отвезли в тюрьму, в пятницу я был уже свободен, но в городе…. Игра 13/10

My summer car is such an interesting indie game that you wouldn't see any big name people talking about. My Summer Car is literally just a game about building a car; tightening every nut and bolting down every single part. The game forces you to manually assemble a car and tune it and it does this all expecting you to know what you're doing. My Summer Car is a Finnish masterpiece. It doesn't hold your hand, it doesn't pamper you. You are a grown Finnish man who drinks beer and punches Teimo in the face just because you can.

My Summer Car is the best survival game with car building mechanics on steam. It is by no means perfect, it is one hell of a buggy mess at worse and a clunky slow paced grind at best sometimes, but that's why I love it. The gameplay is just right enough to be that one of a kind of experience that just isn't for everyone. No other game can capture the essence that Topless gun has created. 

All in all, MSC is sometimes buggy, and slow, but its a game that doesn't hold your hand at all and expects you to cross an 18 lane highway while blind. 9/10 would buy again when My Winter Car comes out.
