holy shit the messiah has returned in the form of a shitty finish car game I actively have 8 minutes in this game Title: My Summer Car and the Brain-Melting Joy of Finnish Chaos

Paragraph 1:
From the moment you spawn shirtless in a messy Finnish house with nothing but a broken car and a full bladder, My Summer Car makes it very clear: this isn’t your average video game. There are no tutorials, no quests, and no hand-holding. It’s just you, some beer, and a summer that might kill you. But within that harsh reality lies a level of joy so pure and chaotic that it feels like your brain might just explode just like Kurt Cobain back in 94

The game is a mechanical sandbox that rewards both obsessive attention to detail and the kind of trial-and-error experimentation that would make a mechanic cry. Every nut and bolt on the car must be properly fitted, torqued, and assembled in the correct order. And when you finally turn the key and hear that old deathtrap of an engine cough to life for the first time, it’s not just satisfaction it made me goon so much I might quit jerk mate ranked

What makes My Summer Car goon so much is its complete disregard for modern game conventions. There are no checkpoints. You can die by peeing on an electric socket.(my favorite pastime) You can flip your van into a lake. You can get into a drunken brawl with your girlfriend over child support. It’s a beautiful, grotesque mess that never tries to be more than what it is and I would let this game rail me Thomas the tank engine style.

Paragraph 4:
The game’s Finnish setting is so vivid and unfiltered, it’s practically a character itself. Whether you're sweating in the sauna, racing down dirt roads while blasting death metal, or angrily cursing in Finnish after stalling on a hill, the game immerses you in a very specific type of rural chaos. It’s like visiting a foreign country through a hangover-fueled fever dream.

Paragraph 5:
Then there’s the humor―dark, crude, and unapologetic. The NPCs are rude, lazy, or downright insane. You’ll get obscene phone calls, run errands for drunk uncles, and receive aggressive letters in the mail. And somehow, all of this just adds to the charm. The game is a love letter to dysfunction and I want timo to blow my balls up the helium balloons until the burst

But beneath the chaos is a genuine depth. You learn to budget, to plan routes, to maintain hygiene. It’s not a checklist game―it’s a life sim, in the messiest and most human way. When you finally finish building your car and pass your first inspection, it feels like a real accomplishment, not because of any reward, but because you did it.

The permadeath mechanic elevates every moment. That highway drive isn’t just a commute―it’s a high-stakes gamble. A mistake at 140 km/h can end your entire save file. That tension adds a jolt of adrenaline that few games offer. It turns even the mundane into an epic quest.

Let’s not forget the sound design. From the clunk of tools to the roar of your junkyard racer, everything feels tactile and real. The engine sounds alone are enough to make gearheads tear up with joy―or panic when something doesn’t sound quite right. It’s as much about listening as it is doing.

In a world full of polished, corporate game design, My Summer Car is pure punk rock. It doesn’t care if you rage-quit or cry. It doesn't care if you fail. In fact, it sort of expects you to. But if you stick with it, the game becomes one of the most satisfying, hilarious, and fun experiences you’ll ever have―explosively so.

So yes, My Summer Car made me metaphorically blow my head off with fun. Not because it’s easy or pretty or even nice―but because it’s real. It's the kind of absurd, grungy, unforgettable fun that comes from wrestling with chaos and emerging victorious, sweaty, and slightly traumatized. And I wouldn’t want it any other way.

If you've played any of the previous you'll know what you're getting in to for the most part. Some of the changes were questionable at first but my coop partner and I got use to it fairly quickly once we stopped expecting it to be "like the old games". 

The campaign has been replaced by just a rogue-like system of mission after mission that you can gamble forward with skulls earned in previous missions to bet whether you survive the next. 

Barricades have been limited to a set amount of 12(?) for solo and 10(?) for coop per person. They are now free and there is a barricade you can buy as a trap that works the same but also buffs traps adjacent to it but costs quit a bit. 

Difficulty needs to be set at the start of every round, so if you gamble forward you stay on the same difficulty unless you quit or start a new round. You can save runs after every mission if you need a break or s change of pace. 

The newest update with additional traps and mechanics are what really sold it to me. It doesn't do too much to mess with whatever OCD style you have for min-maxing the game if you want, but it allows for altering play styles if you so choose. 

Put it on easy for a chill time and watch something on your second monitor. Put it on higher difficulties for scratching your own eyeballs out with colors and numbers flashing everywhere. 

HAVE FUN

So, the first time I started it, it immediately feels like Fortnite with potentially all of its complications.
So, in short, I refunded it.

Well... that's not the only reason.
The game has weird graphic issue when you don't use DLSS and to be fair, you need DLSS to run the game. I kid you not.
Without DLSS, my mediocore pc can only run it for 27 fps in ultra settings and it shows a lot of artifacts.
With DLSS it becomes 31 fps. So, the natural direction is decreasing the settings to High and using DLSS, Even with the settings, I can't even get to 60 FPS stable.
In this aspect, this game becomes AAA games: unoptimized and has good graphic.

I am not expecting my RTX 3050 to run with all the eye candies but going for medium settings really decrease the immersive by a lot. The gap between High graphic settings and Medium graphic settings is simply too wide.
So, in the end, it is me, probably.
I simply didn't expect that my mediocore PC can't run smooth 1080p 60fps in this game.
Plus, I loathe Fortnite and this game gives Fortnite vibes... like the moment you can move the character.

The Game looks so promising at first. Look at all those cool new traps, the skill tree, the characters and so on.
But compared to the previous orcs must die it basically cuts down to: Performance is absolutely abysmal and theres no FSR or DLSS. The game almost exclusively uses bouncing lights and if you disable SSAO it becomes a blockout without baked lights and shadows. they removed all weapons, all trinkets, half of the effects of all traps and hiding some of those behind random cards you have to draw while in a run, making some traps basically worthless in my opinion. Barricades are free now but have a limit, you cant really make a maze anymore. No warmissions. Theres no voicelines in other languages than english (there was in omd3). It feels that without all upgrades from the skilltree youre substantially weaker and not that youre gonna be stronger in the future if you know what I mean. The difficulty ramps up completely unreasonably. The whole game is basically an early access release with 2 years development ahead.
But its not on the sign. This is supposed to be a full release. There's not even a codex where you can look up weaknesses of enemies or what the statuseffects do. Everything is rushed and untested. To release this game and call it a full release is a fucking audacity. I'll never buy something from this studio again. Fuck you.

Я фанат этой серии. Но это не ранний доступ, поэтому тут должен быть негативный отзыв. 

1. Нормальные скины только в саппортерс паке. 
2. С оптимизацией все плохо. 
3. Убрали систему снаряжения из 3 части - это шаг назад, большая ошибка. 
4. Мало карт, очень мало карт. 
5. Контента в целом мало, это могло быть приемлемо для раннего доступа, но не для релиза. 

И все это печально, потому что я бы купил новый OMD даже вдвое дороже, если бы в нем было больше контента. А сейчас даже с 20 процентной скидкой, ощущение осталось, что это была плохая сделка. Этот обзор скорее для разработчиков, если вы игрок - купите и посмотрите, за два часа вполне сможете составить мнение. Я надеюсь, что игру доработают и тогда смогу оставить положительный отзыв.

Categorizing this game as a Tower Defense, even in the broadest definition of the word, is bullocks.  The block used to create mazes has a limited quantity.  So every single map ends up with a squigly S at the most efficient bend in the path and that's about it.  The roguelite mechanics are hastily tacked on in an attempt to follow a trend, but the genre they're being bolted onto doesn't incorporate them well.

Lack of interface and gameplay options is vexing in 2025.  Let me zoom out just a little, ffs.

If I wanted to play plants vs zombies, I'd play plants vs zombies.

An odd entry to the Tales franchise that is both deeply flawed and considerably underrated. 

Cons:

-World lore is weak. The interesting world design hints at so many greats ideas that must have been cut during production. The game does a terrible job making the player feel connected to the world or the stakes involved for anyone other than your party. Granted, it seems like every Tales game after Abyss has had this problem, but that doesn't mean graces should get a pass for it either. 

-A handful of frustrating difficulty spikes. Luckily there are only a few, but it can be frustrating watching your allies go down to ranged 1-hit KOs over and over again because they're too dumb to dodge. You can abuse the unlimited GRADE shop upgrades afforded by the remaster to avoid all of this but then you also risk snapping the difficulty in two like a twig.  

-Music is lacking. Most Tales have great soundtracks, but Graces is unfortunately one of the weakest in the series with low quality and low effort tunes throughout. At least the battle themes are great, which is fortunate because...


Pros:

-Best battle system in the series; easily. It doesn't fall prey to clunky controls, OP free run, or late-bloomer syndrome where it takes a while to really shine like the older games. It also doesn't fall prey overwrought mechanics that end up doing more harm than good like the newer games. It's a perfect balance between the two by being crisp, quick, and (mostly) balanced with a sensible and fun introduction with tons of room for depth given the variety of arts, characters, and titles--which can be used to guide character growth. The dodge mechanic is at its best here, providing an excellent feeling of risk vs. reward considering a perfect dodge can be followed up with a devastating combo while a whiff can mean YOU eat a nasty combo!  

-One of the best cast of characters in the series. The story itself isn't bad, but it's unfortunately dragged down by the lore problem. The characters, on the other hand, are just so much fun. The two main protagonists, Asbel and Sophie, are particularly likable with their brother/sister dynamic that isn't afraid to lean into adorable anime tropes and thought-out character development in equal amounts. I absolutely appreciated the break from expected main protagonist romances that are in 90% of Tales games. Vesperia also broke from this trend, but I just didn't enjoy the Yuri/Estelle starry-eyed-princess-proceeds-to-have-zero-chemistry-with-an-anti-hero-douche anywhere near as much as the Asbel/Sophie emotionally-stunted-big-bro-bonds-with-an-emotionally-despondent-headpat-bait-stranger. Unfortunately, some characters don't get as much development as others, but I found I was OK with this because not every game needs to give every character filler arcs just because the typical JRPG rules say so. Sophie and Asbel are front and center here and it does the game a lot of good. 

If likable characters and an excellent battle system are enough to carry a JRPG experience for you then absolutely check this one out. It'd likely be one of the best Tales games if they'd just ironed out the kinks but that doesn't stop it from being an overall enjoyable experience.

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review: As a huge fan of Ender Lilies I was beyond hyped when I heard that Ender Magnolia was coming and it definitely didn't disappoint a bit. I loved the game so much and the story was as good as the first game and it made me tear up at times too. Also the music is phenomenal like Ender Lilies. All in all, I had a blast playing Ender Magnolia and I hope they make another sequel because this series is a masterpiece ??

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review:
TLDR: It's a good sequel. If you liked Ender Lillies, you will like this one. Stop reading this and go play.

In terms of gameplay, exploration, art style and [b]music[/b], the game is awesome. I love Mili's music.

The difficulty options in this game are [b]awesome[/b]. You can tweak the enemies health, damage, stun resistance, etc. You can make the game as hard as you want, or make it a bit easier if you want. I personally loved to make the game a bit more challenging in my own way.

The game improves upon the first one, adding more mechanics that let you customize your character and abilities.

My only issue is the story. Don't get me wrong, it's good. But it looses some of the tragic aspect of the first game which I really liked. The world of Ender Lillies felt darker and grim, while the story and lore felt more complex and intricate. So not a bad story by any means, just different.

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist

All the game play parts are improved: map design, skills, movements...

The story and music are worse than the first one, especially the music.

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review: 氛围感没前作强，剧情的逻辑也不是很完善感觉阉割了很多内容，特别是上层只有一张地图，中层下层都5，6张的，但是打击感和探图舒服了很多。还是很喜欢这个作品，希望这个系列能继续下去吧

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review:
As someone who borderline would not recommend Ender Lilies, Ender Magnolia is a unilateral improvement in just about every way and I always love to see devs improve so noticeably like this between games.  I feel more comfortable recommending this one.

The art is better, the music is better, the map design is a little bit better.  It has some whacky difficulty problems, the base normal difficulty starts disappointingly easier than Lilies but then crosses a point where towards the end enemies and bosses will two-shot you regardless of how much defense you have, which is sort of frustrating.  But the difficulty is customizeable.

Your toolset is a little more pared down and focused, with enough variety to justify using more than just a single loadout, and I actually got mileage out of learning to parry this time.

The writing is still pretty bland yet still miles ahead of the first game.

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review:
玩完前作后立刻开始的本作游戏，可以明显看出制作组明白前作的缺陷有什么，我提出的问题都有改善：小地图、飞行小怪应对方式更多样，取消了必须靠技能位移才能获取的收集品，简体中文本地化水平也有提高。同时还有很多我没想到会改的点也修改了，比如技能使用次数取消、普通攻击位移取消等，战斗手感好了不少。在此基础上，本作的美术水平比前作更好了，BGM有人评价退步，我倒认为算是保持了相近的水准

但不得不说的是，本作虽然肉眼可见体量更大，然而体量大并不代表更好，以下是我认为本作存在的缺点
1.休息点的设置有问题，尤其是地下水道、魔导工厂、上层统治区这三张地图，极容易出现跑了很久都没有看到下个休息点在哪，解锁全图后很容易看出来休息点离得过远，基本只有入口和BOSS前有，死亡体验极差；
2.没有受击保护，偏偏又有很多持续攻击的小怪，很容易被秒杀
3.地图设计感有倒退，我认为只有中层的钢骨街、生命研究所、上层统治区有着不错的探索感，其它图设计过于简单，基本从头到尾只有一条路可走，没有探索感。地图与地图之间的连接方式也没有惊喜
4.本作加入了很多对话，比如休息点对话、进入底层中层上层时的对话等。然而对话并没有带来更好的角色塑造，有的基本只是角色元素的堆砌，最终并没有带来比前作更好的剧情体验，这点非常可惜
5.技能升级的设定，初衷很好，让玩家可以自由切换各种技能，改变了前作升级难导致的套路固定问题。然而升级材料过于复杂，游戏过程中根本不知道升级材料要如何获取，等搞明白的时候游戏已经快结束了

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review:
I guess I'm one of the few people who really don't find this game to be fun. 2D platformers are one of the few genres that are really hard to mess up. I know this because I've played many popular 2D platformers in the past and almost all of them would at least feel fun to play. It's weird how I don't feel the same with this game though. Maybe because it is a Metroidvania game? Well I've also played some other Metroidvanias in the past like Hollow Knight, Castlevania and even Metroid, but this game just doesn't good to play.

Movement in this game feels really janky. To be honest I don't mind a little bit of jank. I've played Megaman games before and I know how janky movements feel compared to fast-paced 2D platformers like Celeste and Cuphead. The problem with Ender Magnolia though is the fact that animations also look janky and I know that this game is inspired by Vanillaware games like 13 Sentinels and Odin Sphere, but if you know anything about Odin Sphere is that it is a completely different game and does not really focus on platforming unlike this game. You can't just use 2D RPG which plays like a fighting game as an inspiration to build a 2D-platformer-metroidvania game. It just won't work that way. Everything in this game from platformer to combat, looks and feels janky. It doesn't feel as satisfying as playing as Megaman or Hollow Knight.

Bosses are really easy to cheese. I haven't finished the game yet but most bosses in this game feel a bit too underpowered with the amount of abilities that you have. One boss in particular has this big rolling turd as a weapon and all I had to do was get behind it and smack it to death cause it kept doing the same thing leaving me an opening each time. Usually in other 2D combat you'd get a certain moment where you'd have to strategise on when you can land a hit safely without taking damage. In this game, you'd just have to camp on a spot and move ever so slightly to damage bosses to their demise.

Exploration is anything but fun. This game feels like Dark Souls 2 (no offense to DS2 because I love that game and has like 100 hours of playtime) of the Soulsborne series because I feel like the exploration itself is more difficult than the bosses. You won't get any i-frames after being attacked, and if more than one enemy strikes you all at once, you won't get a chance to live. At least I find Dark Souls 2 exploration to be fun because once you've understood the layout of each area you can strategise and traverse those areas with lower risk of dying, and there are i-frames when certain animations are playing (like backstabbing for instance). The problem with Ender Magnolia is that enemies can swarm you with attacks that you can't easily get out of which makes it really frustrating. The game also has parrying mechanics which aren't really clear on how they work. I feel like sometimes I already initiated a parry but still got hit nonetheless. Is there an attack I can't parry or should I position my character in a certain way when parrying?  Is there a window when a parrying animation is playing? Can I parry more than one projectile at once?

Personally, I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone, especially Odin Sphere players. Odin Sphere fans, if you're looking for a similar game, this isn't it. It isn't even anywhere close to that game and you'll be severely disappointed. Save your money and look elsewhere. I'd recommend Astlibra if you want something that resembles Odin Sphere, even for a little bit.

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review:
[h1]程よいy易度の正y派メトロイドヴァニア[/h1]
前作の荒かった部分がブラッシュアップされ、更に[びやすくなった2Dアクションゲ`ム。
前作?今作ともにトロコンしたのでレビュ`。

【良かった点】
[list]
    [*]くも幻想的な舞台を彩るハイクオリティなグラフィックとBGM
    [*]探索のM盲分かりやすい非常にH切なマップC能
    [*]ストレスを感じない自キャラの操作性と程よいy易度
    [*]ボス前にポイントが用意されているのでボスとの再椁ラク
    [*]私は利用しなかったが、かいy易度{整が可能なので多分2Dアクション初心者も安心
[/list]

【かった点】
[list]
    [*]一部のワ`プポイント多用マップが探索にyxして少しストレス
    [*]自キャラにダメ`ジ後のorgやノックバックがないため、一部ダメ`ジ判定がLく残る攻膜蚴埭堡萍此坤工毪长趣ある
    [*]前作に比べて固有NPCや会イベント等がえたものの、シナリオに前作ほどのインパクトはなかった
[/list]

tじて、非常に丁に作られた正y派2Dアクションゲ`ムといった印象。
本作だけでもSしめるが、ぜひ前作からプレイしてきたい。

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review:
于2025年5月9日下午22点，共用时19小时通关AB两结局并达成steam全成就，版本号为Version1.1.1。本作个人推荐度9/10，下面将从几个角度谈一下和前作的区别：
1、手柄的打击手感和打击反馈较前作有明显提升
2、取消了恶心的碰撞伤害
3、技能树较前作更加直观，探索技能更加丰富
4、前作中非常隐蔽恶心的隐藏点位数量大幅减少，仍有少量
5、地图设计和前作大差不差，但是最后一张图只有两个篝火有点恶心，不小心死了就365里路了
6、加入了商店和货币系统，三种货币刷起来太麻烦，如果你想要搬空商店需要一直刷个几百万

[h1]一些碎碎念[/h1]
莉莉亚有些意难平，B结局虽然没说，但是也活不了。露薇简直是超人，哪里都有这个小姑娘，怕不是也杀穿了地图。

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review: A must-play for metroidvania fans, especially if you've played the prequel. Major gameplay improvements comparing to Ender Lilies-combats feel much more satisfying. Aesthetically and musically pleasing as expected but still there's something Ender Lilies did better. Overall 9.5/10.

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review: Game was clearly made by metroidvania-fans inspired by Hollow Knight. And they did a good job, the game is a good metroidvania, that does everything right. And that's exactly the game's problem, it doesn't have any more to it than that, no charm, no uniqueness, nothing that would make more out of it, than just another Hollow Knight clone. On top of that, game's production value is rather low, game looks and feels very cheap, not much progress was made from Ender Lilies. If i were to call best thing about this game it would be OST, which says a lot. 6/10.

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review: There are some really good areas and others that are quite bad. The music follows a similar pattern―some tracks are great, while others are not, much like in the previous game. However, the strong areas, excellent music, and the game's great atmosphere come together so well that they overshadow the weaker parts. The combat is solid, making the overall experience very enjoyable.

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review:
Отличное продолжение, из игры убрали все проблемы Ender Lilies и добавили еще больше удобств и механик. 
Локации лёгкие, красивые, не напряжные,исследовать мир было интересно, а удобные маркеры позволили пройти игру даже не обращаясь к гайдам или иным источникам информации, что я считаю очень классно и показывает как разработчики хотели чтобы игрокам было удобно и комфортно исследовать этот мир.
Боевка стала чуть более глубже, добавили несколько видов способностей к каждому гомункулу чтобы каждый мог подобрать билд под себя. 
В итоге если брать общее впечатления об игре это твёрдый стредняк. В игре нет ничего сверх естественного, но и бесячих моментов тоже нету, что можно выделить это фишка с маркерами на карте, которые ставятся сами. Я считаю что каждая метроидвания должна взять эту особенность.

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review: Indie Of The Year 2025

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review: This is a really good sequel to Ender Lillies. The QoL upgrades are phenomenal and I hope to see this applied to many more MVs. All that said, outside of that I don't think it's a better game than Ender Lillies. The writing and atmosphere just doesn't reach that same level. THAT SAID, this is still a fantastic game that will absolutely be one of my favourite MVs of this year, if not my #1.

ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review: T?o maravilhoso quanto seu antecessor, só que melhorado!

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review: 玩完就感觉制作组比起作品玩法更担心二代褒姒。作为类银河很早就解锁二段跳空中冲刺这种在别的同类型游戏中要放到中期解锁的能力。随时传送死亡不掉落难度调整兴趣点自动标记等功能就是把害怕玩家坐牢写在脸上。可能制作组很清楚地图设计boss设计等创新方面他们并不是强项，因此把重点都放在了改善玩家体验以及人设美术音乐上，不得不说虽然策略性强了点但是确实有效

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review:
Fantastic, charming follow-up to ENDER LILIES. 

Improves on the first game in every way. Lilac is a far more enjoyable vehicle for the narrative, including the dynamics within the growing group of companions who join her. The first game is far from a bad entry, but MAGNOLIA surpasses its older sister in all the ways that matter. The quiet, isolating oppression of the first is bested by the crushing weight of hope of the second. 
------------------------
[i]This world might be Hell, but we'll live on and fight back. Because I believe the choice you made wasn't wrong.[/i]
------------------------
Some of the later game companions feel mostly vestigial, that is, in part because you get them so late and/or they take space otherwise occupied by more enticing characters. A good problem to have, but it's a shame (Ranged Primary option in particular is nearly pointless to use when the Melee Primary is a core story character).
------------------------
Buy it, play it, love it. 
Between Nine Sols and ENDER MAGNOLIA, we're spoiled for choice before Silksong comes to challenge them for the crown. 
The crushing weight of hope...again.

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review: So many good systems.  I just wish it wasn't quite so hard to guard/dodge the bosses when they decide to teleport or attack the entire screen...

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review:
Let  me start by saying I am not good at these types of games. 

I always play on easy mode (when available) and always use a guide. 
I don't like spending hours just trying to figure out where to go.

So, having said that, I enjoyed the game for the most part.

Pros...

Great music
Great progression system..you're still getting new items, weapons and enemies even at the end of the game.
Great graphics
Great combat

Cons

Just one big one for me...

Some of the levels with their warp gates and crazy traversal systems, (like having to break walls that are completely on a different screen and you can't see)  are just to big and convoluted for me.

Much of this was mitigated by using a guide but it was still frustrating at times.

Also, for me the story was somewhat meh and towards the end of the game I had definitely had enough and was ready to move on.

Still, for fans of this genre, I'm sure  they will like this game quite a bit.

game_name: ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist
review:
音乐比起一代略逊一筹，剧情也不如一代
不过别的方面都提升很多，画风比一代讨喜非常多，战斗系统更加完善也更有深度一些，很多细节打磨得也不错
和一代一样作为一个类银河城游戏确实体量还是小了一点，内容再多点就更好了
难度方面有直接可配置的难度同时也有相关的收益，这一点很不错，不过总体来说难度还是偏低且难度曲线有点不太合理
非常期待下一作能够有更多莉莉的剧情！

Super quick to get super boring

打完了序章和第一关，已停手。
1）弱智的自动寻路：序章和第一关就那么几个兵和英雄，已经出现频繁的自我卡位。后面人多起来，不知道画面有多美。
2）低效的攻击目标选择逻辑，甚至还远远不如上古时代的星际一和帝国二。举个例子：两个敌人在前方，一个正面，一个侧面稍远，所有部队平A过去，即便道路十分开阔，近战部队也会全部冲向最近的敌人，相互堵路长达数秒时间，而侧面零点几秒路程之远的敌人完全没有部队去管。（别的不说，想象一下星际的多线爆狗偷几个矿区，每群狗如果都只知道瞄着最近的一个敌人冲，输出效率得有多低，哈哈哈哈哈）
3) 键位、单位识别度和UI设计，既不像魔兽星际红警帝国等任何一款主流rts那么教科书，也不像亿万尸潮那么简化和休闲。有点反直觉。

剧情暂时不评价，因为我没打穿，只能说目前这两关的剧情很无语，没有继续玩下去的动力。
同类型游戏，相比之下更加推荐亿万尸潮，那个玩了两百多个小时（虽然我本人其实更喜欢本作的魔幻题材，但无奈游戏性的差距过大）。
SOLID GAME

I can't recommend it.  It's easy to draw a comparison to We Are Billions, but the improved story and additional mechanics make it just different enough, though in some ways the mechanics are a bit worse

The combat balancing feels pretty bad and the missions themselves are slow and awkwardly paced, with features drip fed out. Advancement is slow and not especially rewarding. Defensive structures are expensive and not very effective, so it's usually best to focus on troops.  It lacks the balance between siege, ranged, cavalry, etc that other RTS titles do so well, and the economy portion of the game is distracting, with limited options.

If you want to shut your brain off and go old school RTS (ie build a ton of troops and send them at the enemy camp) then it will scratch that itch with a few twists. Otherwise, it doesn't do much with the genre, and the ideas that ARE new suffer from a mediocre implementation.

It's a fun game but still rough. 
The connection issues for multi-player seem to have improved but there's still hiccups. 

The game difficulty scales pretty sharply.

Age Of Darkness: Final Stand
Score: 7.5 out of 10

3 Major Pros:

Atmosphere & Lighting: The dark fantasy setting slaps. The fog-of-war, lighting, and shadows create a legitimately tense survival feel.

Massive Enemy Hordes: You want scale? Try surviving against 70,000 enemies on screen. It’s chaos, and it’s glorious.

Strategic Gameplay: It's not just build-and-click. You have to really think about defense, positioning, and resource use or you’ll get wiped. Fast.

3 Major Cons:

Performance Dips: The game chokes when too much hits the fan. Big waves = frame drops. Optimization still ain’t final-stand ready.

Limited Unit Diversity: The unit types are kind of barebones. After a while, it starts to feel same-y.

Steep Difficulty Curve: This one doesn’t hold your hand. Some early waves feel like punishment, not challenge.

If you're into RTS survival hybrids and don’t mind a bit of rough polish, this one’s worth the pain.

For more brutally honest reviews, come find me on Instagram at “What RemLite Think.”

Nobody wanted a horrible story mode that took them a year and a half to make. SO bad, SO BORING. You took "they are billions" and spent years making nothing good or new that I want.

Age of Darkness: Final Stand delivers a unique blend of base-building and large-scale battles against swarms of nightmarish enemies. The atmosphere is intense, the visuals are striking, and the “Death Night” events keep you constantly on edge. It’s a rewarding challenge for strategy fans who love defending against overwhelming odds. Highly recommend the game!

Great Game, really fun to get swarmed to  failure.

As someone who is pretty new to the RTS genre, I think I've gotten better at RTS from playing Age of Darkness. Survival mode is brutal, but overcoming the challenge has helped me act more quickly. A fair criticism is that there are not many options for dealing with the crushers, and replayability gets a bit repetitive. But, I'm 100 hours in and still have not cleared the hardest difficulty (I've cleared horrific, got cheated on the last stand in nightmare - one of the crystals changed directions). Coupled with a short 10 mission campaign, I like this game as an intro to the RTS genre.

Hm, was soll ich sagen. Ich bin Fan der Reihe, ich mag das Story-Telling und die verschiedenen Handmechaniken. Was ich hier jetzt aber sagen muss: Der vierte ist bisher der schlechteste Teil. 

Gefühlt weniger Checkpoints und eher rudiment?re Gegner zum Schluss hin. Mühsame Szenen, die sich bei einem Tod zu lange hinziehen und ganz zum Ende (leider) mehr und mehr Bugs. 

Von einem ab und zu unsichtbaren Gegner, H?nde, die hindurch greifen, nicht nachvollziehbare Spielmechanik im Kampf. 
Teilweise konnte man den gleichen Gegner mal mit der Shooting-Hand abschütteln, ?fters aber nicht. Ein ben?tigter Gegenstand IM Boden, statt da, wo er wirklich sein sollte. Das machte es oft zur Geduldsprobe, und nach über einer Stunde im letzten Kampf, den ich durch Bugs nicht beenden konnte, habe ich mir die zwanzig Minuten übriges Spiel dann doch lieber auf YouTube angesehen, weil es einfach zu nervig war.

Es ist sch?n, dass auf die verschiedenen Charaktere eingegangen wurde, ich h?tte mir jedoch mehr Notizen gewünscht, um die Geschichte noch mehr aufzudecken. Sonst h?tte ich gesagt, kann man machen, ist aber eine Sache des Glücks/Pechs.

Das Ende l?sst auf einen fünten Teil hoffen. Ich tr?ume von weniger Bugs und werde ihm trotzdem einen Try geben. :)

As you play, you can unlock more things from a vending machine. Some people have complained that this dilutes the pool and makes the game harder. You can turn off unlocks once you've got them, but I haven't turned anything off and can still consistently beat the game on the hardest difficulty. I'm not even a sweat, I'm just messing stringing together fun builds and it just works.

10/10 would recommend.

Probably the best traditional roguelike ever made.

I liked it at first....but then....it got really tedious.

You cannot even walk through an area without some kind of status affliction which will inevitably result in the loss of a limb or some convoluted cure that just gives you MORE status afflictions on your way to procure the cure. It's all very pointless.

Story is a mess as well, a lot of nonsense thrown at you with way too many factions to keep track of. It's just ends up with you not caring after you learn the basics. TOME is a much better roguelike.

The other issue is that the game is a mile wide and an inch deep. NPC interations are quite shallow, and you just putz around on the random map until you have enough levels to continue the main quest. It just ends up being a chore.

The game looks great though.

game_name: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
review:
It nails the atmosphere of the first movies perfectly and is fun adventure game.

Good:
    - The presentation is excellent. Great graphics and smooth frame rates. The global illumination system is among the best I've seen.
    - The voice acting, sound effects and music are really good.
    - The story and dialog is very well written. It's up there with the original trilogy of movies.
    - Almost no loading times. The whole game is seamless.

Bad:
    - This was a very buggy game. It took months and 4 patches before I could finish the game. Most major bugs are fixed now though.
    - Checkpoints only. You can't manually save at all and the checkpoints are rare and often in bad spots.
    - It's easy to get trapped in a maze and the map don't show where exits are.
    - The platforming part is the worst part of the game. It can be quite buggy with collisions and timing, especially later in the game.

The main story took around 15 hours, but there's a lot of extra side quests and exploring you can do if you want more.

I have tried so hard and put many hours into this game to try and enjoy it, and its a constant battle. My system is well above minimum requirements and yet it consistently runs horribly. I have turned to multiple different forums, Reddit posts, google, friends, different settings, all fresh updated drivers, i even updated bios, verified files, and uninstalled/reinstalled. Nothing has made an improvement. I load into multiple zones with whole floors missing, 80% of my spells never show. Enemies being frozen or ignited don't show, boss mechanics sometimes, and the amount of times i have died due to something just appearing on me is depressing. I have seen dozens of posts with people having the same problems. GGG needs to stop with the QOL changes and work on the playability and performance issues this game has. I am literally unable to play it until something changes.

i7 9700 and RTX 2080 are well enough above the requirements to not have these issues.

This game has huge potential but.. right now there is nothing here. End game is boring, campaign is too short, trading sucks because there is no auction house. All of this with the added benefit of 1 new class and some new ascendencies plus you'll never find loot. Even with the latest loot patch, next to nothing of value ever drops. Save your money for now if you're considering buying.

Кроме метовых билдов ничего не наносит урон. Жалею что потратл время на игру. Пофиг на лаги, баги и вообще. Дело в том что кроме метовых билдов ничего не наносит урон, вообще. Ты либо собираешь мету по гайдам, мета которая меняется, либо твой персонаж тыква и смысла нет никакого в том как ты билдишься. Разработчики постоянно пытаются что-то нерфить и непонятно что хотят увидеть в этом игре.
Докочался до 90лвл, чистил карты т15 в соло. Не проблема на метовом билде. Но стоит проявить фантазию, и сразу твой персонаж тыква. Просто тыква. Непонятно зачем такая игра нужна и такое дерево умений. Если ты не можешь играть чем захочешь. Очень много кокблоков, просто кокблок на кокблоке.
Ну супер плохо этого.  Игре можно было-бы простить абсолютно все, если бы не кокблоки и можно было играть тем чем захочется.

"Hi there,

Thank you for the message and I am sorry to hear about this issue. Unfortunately we are not currently offering email Technical Support, due to limited staff resources. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.

The development team have provided the following resource to help with troubleshooting technical issues: https://www.pathofexile.com/forum/view-thread/3072628

We also recommend checking out the Known Issues thread to see if the issue you are experiencing is listed here: https://www.pathofexile.com/forum/view-thread/1733474

Otherwise, please post your issue in the Technical Support subforum and include as much information as you can. You can find this subforum here: https://www.pathofexile.com/forum/view-forum/support

Alternatively, if you believe you are experiencing a bug, you can post in the Bug Reports forum here: https://www.pathofexile.com/forum/view-forum/bug-reports

Kind regards,
Ramon"

Simplesmente o melhor Diablo like de todos os tempos. Na verdade, atualmente dizer que ele é um jogo parecido com Diablo é uma ofensa, dado o que a Blizzard fez com a franquia a partir de Diablo 3. 

Depois de jogar os dois, pra mim n?o tem compara??o: POE2 faz D4 parecer um jogo meia-boca. Vou explicar por quê:

1?? Builds que realmente importam
Enquanto no Diablo 4 você fica refém dos mesmos 3-4 builds "meta" (e qualquer coisa diferente é lixo), POE2 te dá liberdade TOTAL. O sistema de gemas + passivas + ascendências é simplesmente o melhor do gênero - e ainda tem as combina??es de classes que permitem coisas como um Mago-Guerreiro ou um Ca?ador-Necromante.

2?? Combate que exige skill, n?o só stats
D4 é só "aumentar dano e tankar" C em POE2 você precisa ESQUIVAR, posicionar direito e aprender os padr?es dos chefes. As lutas s?o épicas, algumas levam 5+ minutos e d?o aquela adrenalina que faz falta em Diablo.

3?? Loot que n?o é só enfeite de inventário
Em D4, 99% do que dropa é lixo. Em POE2, até item branco pode ser útil com os sistemas de craft. E sem aquela palha?ada de ter que farmar 300 horas pra UM item lendário decente.

4?? Endgame desde o come?o
D4 demorou 6 meses pra adicionar conteúdo decente pós-campanha. POE2 já chega com Atlas, masmorras aleatórias, eventos especiais... e isso só na Early Access!

5?? Grinding Rewarding vs. Grinding Punitive
Em D4 você farma 50 dungeons idênticas pra UPAR UM GLYPH. Em POE2, cada mapa/miss?o te dá algo útil C mesmo que seja só currency pra craft.

Veredito: D4 é bonitinho pra quem quer algo casual, mas POE2 é O ARPG pra quem quer profundidade, desafio e liberdade. A Grinding Gear Games entende o que os f?s do gênero querem C ao contrário da Blizzard, que só quer vender battle pass.

Nota 9.5/10 (só n?o dou 10 porque ainda tá em desenvolvimento, mas já é melhor que 90% dos ARPGs no mercado)
GAME GOOD, ITEM SHOP TERRIBLE
PoE 2 > Diablo > PoE 1

It should be a loot-based Action RPG. It could be good action RPG, if they would cut most of the maps in half and focus on the boss fights. Or it could have good loot. At moment, it has none of those. The campaign is incredibly boring, especially the second half of act 3, which you have to do twice, for good measure. It was interesting once, passable the second time, kinda boring the 3rd time, now I'm hate-playing through it. The maps are just a slog fest. You move slow, while everything else moves blazing fast. The loot is nowhere to be seen. 4 out of the 11 rare mobs on a map dropped only gold and white items. Other 4 dropped a blue item besides gold and whites. 2 of them dropped a yellow, one dropped a blue and 1 waystone. On a juiced out rare map. I have no more reasons to play, until something changes. Loot was alright at release, but the devs felt the need to "fix" it. Accordingly, I am fixing the game rating on Steam.

I've loved EA of POE 2 since the day it launched. As of writing this it has gotten considerable easier imo, but I dont feel it has taken anything away from what the game is trying to be. I laughed and scoffed at all the people on youtube and social media trashing the game upon its release and demanding changes from GGG. I couldnt help but reduce the situation down to the lowest common denominator, which I feel is people barking at a corporation to change something because it doesnt live up to their expectations. then i just substutited out the variable to see how it would look if it wasnt ggg in question being asked to make changes to a product, but maybe instead McDonalds. Imagine they put out a new burger and it doesnt live up to what the public expects of them and then they make youtube videos and posts on social media asking for a more juicy delictable burger instead.  People are insane and will never be satisfied.

I didn't want to give a review so early in early access, but when I see a bunch of negative reviews, I have to.
The game is different compared to POE1, it's slower and more challenging, but that's a good thing. Version 0.1 was playable and brought improved graphics and an interesting story. The biggest problem was the end game content (it wasn't finished and tuned at all) and the vastness (chaoticness) of some maps.
Version 0.2 brought a lot of nerfs and even more slowdown of the game, which was more of a step back than an improvement. In the current version 0.2.0g, the game's balancing is almost at the original level again and the end game content is already better than in version 0.1. Personally, I like playing new builds and experimenting, and I definitely don't consider the game bad even in such an early version.

Before I get into the review let me explain where I'm coming from, because most of the negative reviews seem to be coming from POE1 veterans, mostly who have experienced the endgame and also POE1 endgame.  I am someone who played POE1, started and stopped before I got to the endgame a few times since its beta.  I'm not an endgame player.

This game has a lot of convenient things that POE1 doesn't have, particularly the lack of constant juggling of a million different currencies.  The skills aren't bound to weapons and armor anymore.  The passive skill tree is still as ginormous as ever.  But for me, what sold me on this game was that it greatly slows the pace down.  This is a very slow game for an action RPG and while it's satisfying sometimes to be able to kill 500 mobs at once with some insane AOE, this game the enemies have a lot of HP and will kill you much faster.  The game is also very sparing about giving you rare drops and that is a GOOD thing, because it means less having to constantly go back to town and manage inventory.  I want items to mean something, not simply be replaced every 5 minutes when you kill some rare mob that drops 500 yellow items on the ground.  

Part of why I never stay with ARPGis because the drops can only mask how boring and repetitive the game can sometimes be for so long.  While POE2 doesn't fully address the repetitive issue that action RPGs are often plagued with, it does provide a good enough challenge where you have to figure things out.  I've entered a couple of main quest locations where I felt under geared and either had to wait for something or until I could get a couple of levels.  

POE2 is simply a different kind of game, and to me the challenge makes it a better game not a more frustrating one, because the challenge is something you can manage.  The other ARPGs have something different to add which is great for the genre, but to me POE2 is a far more immersive experience, more polished, and the conveniences definitely put this slightly above the competition.  Either way I recommend all three (and I own all three too).  You won't regret getting into the EA of this one.

Слишком высокий порог входа в игру,  для новичка без знаний игровых механик и функции торга между игроками может стать не проходимой и желания всё это изучать не у всех появится. Элементы казино выпадения предметов и их характеристики вгоняет в уныние. В игру приходим развлечься и хорошо провести время вместо того, чтоб изучать километры текста и понимать как и что работает в игре. Непропорциональная  усложнение контента где человек будет вынужден искать информацию и повторять за другими людьми для дальнейшего прохождения или просто перестанет играть. Сервера игры не отличаються стабильностью, увеличение пинга которые приводят к твоей смерти или невозможности играть или переодические вылеты на главный экран с различными сообщениями не доставляет никакого удовольствия. Если вы готовы потратить множество часов на то чтоб разобраться в игре и элементы случайности как в казино, вам понравиться игра, в ином случае я не советую.

So far on my 100+ hours of the game, it has been pretty good. But these trials of Sekhamas are the worst slog I've encountered trying to get needed skill points for endgame. This should be something optional, not something to unlock Full Ascendancy. I've gotten to where I just race towards the end, I don't care about any of the experience or loot, or bosses. Because I've done this so many times and have gotten myself trapped in negative rolls. And speaking of bosses, while you are fighting the same one for the umpteenth time, you get this voice over telling you over and over to, "dodge the fire!" Like holy sh** please shut up. Do you know what this game needs? A backseat gaming AI voice that has 3 responses that repeat every 10 seconds. It's not a test in skill, it's a test in RNG and starts driving me mad. For the price and considering it's still in Beta, I would still recommend to someone that really likes Diablo, Torchlight, Grim Dawn. But this thing needs some work on difficulty. A lot of us have to stuff to do, and pulling a slot machine by endgame gets old really quick.

Игра мне понравилась, очень затягивает разбираться во всех аспектах, понимать что шаришь больше чем день назад, билдиться и видеть свой прогресс, НО: 

1. Оптимизация - это ОЧКО. Что с DLSS, что без - один FPS, дропы от незначительных действий на экране, а на т15 мапе и того до 30 дропы случаются. Игре срочно нужна оптимизация
2. Как я понял по отзывам других людей, в прошлой лиге работало много разных билдов, играть можно было через многое, но в этой лиге один билд на всех, максимум два-три. Вариативность маленькая, хочешь быстро проходить мапы - выбора нет.
3. Хочешь качать другой класс - опять по новой бегать шесть сюжетных актов, из которых оригинальных всего три, которые потом повторяются еще раз в более хардовом режиме, это утомляет, хоть и меняется расположение входов и точек на мапе, но логика у них остается одна. 

Но в игре так же и куча плюсов, это мой первый опыт в подобного рода экшен-RPG, и я всем доволен. Сеттинг, графика, комьюнити, механика трейда и внутриигровая экосистема - все невероятно затягивает. Однозначно рекомендую, сам долго думал брать или нет, но я давно хотел подобную рпгшку. Ждать либо релиза, либо патчей (если это имеет смысл).
Дермище получилось полное, разрабы выдавили огромную какаху в новом обновлении, теперь жалею что потратил время зря и деньги!!!

Let me first say that I am very mixed on this game and want to recommend it to new players. However, each new update to the game feels like a punishment to the players. It is like game developers forgot how to let their players have fun. For a game that relies heavily on loot/gear based play, there is hardly any to speak of. 

The only way to reliably find good gear is to purchase it from other players. And ooooohhh boy is that a HUGE hassle. There is no in-game marketplace for players. Yea you read that right. Here we are in 2025 and still the developers did not think to add an in-game marketplace. Instead of making it simple, you must login to your game account on their website while your game is open (sorry single screen gamers). Oh but wait it gets even better. Then when you finally find a gear item with the help(?) of their realllly bad search filters (you have to know what you are looking for, filters don't help much), you have to send a message to the player requesting to purchase it. YEAAAAA a message, you don't out right buy the item for the listed price. So, now you hope the player is online and not in the middle of, ya know, actually playing the game. Then you have to actually meet the player in game to trade with them, watch out for scammers! Good luck! 

Selling items is almost just as bad as buying items. You have to purchase (with real money) an in game stash tab to even begin to sell items to other players. After the hours/days long researching and purchasing of gear you can then finally go back to actually doing what you set out to do... playing the game. 

The game acts (1-3) are interesting the first time through, if a little long. The game acts are a little draining the second time through (yes you must play thru the campaign twice), but manageable. After playing roughly a couple dozen hours (sorry casuals), the game finally opens up and you are free to start playing the actual fun part of the game which is mapping. Mapping feels fun for the most part and definitely more rewarding (gear/loot) than the campaign. The problem comes when you start a new character and realize a startling truth. There is NO skipping the campaign when starting a new character. That means you must play through the campaign YET AGAIN TWO MORE times to get to the fun part. And if you start another new character guess what? Two more campaign playthrus for you! MUCH FUN, SO WOW

Now, you are probably wondering after all the bashing, why I have so many hours in the game? The simple answer is that I hate myself. The complicated answer is that there is a game with a ton of potential just waiting for the developers to actually give a damn about letting their players have actual fun. Game developers if you are seeing this, please give us GOOD loot, add an in-game marketplace that works without needing to meet other players, and please for the love of all that is unholy let us skip the campaign after playing it once. 

tl;dr Game has potential to be amazing if some things are fixed/added

NOTE: This review is written based on ~500 hours of gameplay during the launch month of December 2024 until 06 Jan 2025, so about the first 30 days of release.

I am a hardcore Diablo 2 fiend. Nothing since Diablo 2 has satisfied that itch for me, not Grim Down, Last Epoch, Path of Exile (1), Torchlight (though Torchlight 2 came very close), or any of the others. 

Path of Exile 2 is the first game that's come out where I would say "THIS IS DIABLO 3". 

This game is literally everything from Diablo 2 ramped up to 11. 

The acts follow the same layout as in Diablo 2, the items, the character progression, everything.

This is the best ARPG since Diablo 2. Good enough that it might have actually supplanted Blizzard in the throne.

Чтобы быть объективным Я наиграл 372 часа. Никогда не играл раньше в пое и подобный жанр игр. На хк убил 2х персов физ бладмаг (кек) 84 лвл на первой лиге и уже не помню какой лвл вар кузнец (примерно лвл т10 мапы) на 2ой лиге 
Для Path of Exile 2 - Воплощение худшей игры. Тут ничего из того что я ценю в играх. Если честно у меня создалось впечатление что я играл в какую-то дешевую китайскую браузерную игру. По порядку:
[h3]Сюжет и сеттинг. [/h3]  По поводу сеттинга - 1 акт - вполне не плохо, но в 2ом и 3им акте мы выступаем в роле неких расхитителей древних храмов, при том что мир пое как бы дарк фэнтэзи это выглядит совсем не уместно, особенно различная магия которая не магия а просто эмитирует технологии. Фе. Сюжет не имеет смысла совершенно, я читал все диалоги нпс в первом "прохождении" и вся история строится по принципу мы пытаемся остановить конец света и преследуем плохих челов. Переход в эндгейм это вообще что-то.. Не буду заострять даже внимания на этом и хотя на сколько я понял никто не играет в такие игры ради сюжета, то что они написали в Path of Exile 2 это прям 1/10. 
 
[h3]  Скил.[/h3] Можно подумать раз уж эта игра не про сюжет то это что-то соревновательное, что-то бросающее тебе вызов.. 
- Нет. Я уверен в пое сможет играть 7и летний ребенок. Эта игра просто воплощение каузальности. Большинство билдов однокнопочные. Умирать можно сколько угодно, абсолютно мизерные и не на что ни влияющие штрафы за смерть появляются только в энд гейме. Единственная задача - бежать и убивать мобов, если они падают за секунду и тебе ничего не нужно делать - Ты крут. Это воплощение мечты игроков в пое. Самое забавное что при таком менталитете играть становится настолько скучно что игрокам в пое жизненно необходимо что-то на 2ом мониторе или окно с каким-то видео на основной монитор. Если тебе приходится доджить атаки и отступать, ты явно делаешь что-то не так. 1/10 Некое подобие скила есть при игре на хк (Хардкор 1 жизнь) об этом я расскажу в отдельном пункте, соревновательная сторона пое 1/10
[h3] Стратегия [/h3] Чтож наверное эта игра понравится любителям классических рпг, чтобы часами сидеть с чаем и составлять билд, вы вобще видели это гигантское дерево пассивных умений... 
-Отчасти, но в целом нет. Начну с того что гигантское дерево пассивных скилов - скам. Каждый класс начинает с противоположенной друг другу точки, это значит что у вас никогда не хватит очков умений чтобы добраться до противоположенной стороны и брать перки другого класса без колоссальных жертв. Ведьма и маг вобше почему-то начинают из одной точки и просто заменяют пассивные скилы друг-друга делая их уникальными для класса. Я искорени пытался взять варовский лайфстил и хп на блодмаге тоже же самое с тотемами на хаос ведьме.. в общем 75% этого дерево можно вырезать и оставить по 25% каждому классу. В остальном же у каждого класса есть 2-3 вариации которые становятся понятны из описания умений, и вариативность конечно присутствует но упор в пое идет больше на предметы и камни умений чем на пасивки, а значит ваше стратегическое мышление едва ли сильно поможет добиться главной цели этой игры - не нажимать кнопок и убивать всех мобов. Самые имбовые билды в большинстве случаев работают на синергии уникальных предметов о который вы просто не сможете узнать но при этом собрать что-то свое и играть вполне реально но это не даст вам преимущество перед самым очевидным стилем игры для вашего класса, скорее наоборот вы будете "платить" нажимая лишние кнопки и уменьшая скорости прогрессии  в общем Стратегическая сторона poe на 6/10
[h3] Торговля [/h3] Наверное это единственная игра с хоть как-то работающей экономикой, хотя если говорить про обычные лиги, вы можете купить все что нужно за невероятно дешево, тк лучшие предметы для "лвлинга" (прокачки до 65лвл) никогда не уйдут с рынка и цена на них будет только снижаться так как новые предметы пополняются ежеминутно. И какая-то игра в торговлю и крафт начинается только в лейт гейме. Это может быть интересно но с учетом того что рынок постоянно переполнен единственной доступной тактикой чтобы не сидеть в игре по 20 часов в день, будет тактика сниженных цен и ее воплощения - дампстер чест когда вы скидываете весь лут без разбора в гигантский сундук с фиксированной ценой, да, вы можете продешевить, но это не важно ведь вы "выигрываете вермя" для того чтобы убивать мобов за секунду.   
[h3] Кам юнити [/h3] Наверное самая главная проблема POE2 это ее игроки и ее разработчики. Игроки в пое сами скрытно ненавидят эту игру, по этой причине (или из-за невероятной лени) они платят валюту чтобы за них играли в игру другие и проходили им испытания (единственный интересный рог лайк режим игры с крутыми наградами в виде уровня вознесения) я честно не видел не водной другой игре что-то подобное. Помните драму с Илоном? это вот просто олицетворение успешного играка в POE. И да, тут можно купить валюту за реальные деньги, неофициально и как будто-бы за это банят, но судя по всему не банят так как предложений куча. Итак мы имеем игру без сюжета, без красивого сетинга, не требующую умений и скила с всратой (до очень поздной игры) экономикой и почти без тактической составляющей. И всем это нравится. Все в восторге. Мечта и цель жизни игроков в POE - Не убиваемый билд, на котором не нужно нажимать кнопок, но все мобы умирают за секунду. На втором мониторе стрим или видео, и не нужно ничего делать или думать. Чистый кайф. А те кто не в востоге пишут отрицательные отзывы это челы которые не могут достичь этой цели и жалуются - "Игра не умеет награждать" "В Энд гейме мало контента" Вобщем для аудитории POE описанные мной проблемы это не проблемы, они считают это особенностью жанра, а значит ничего никогда не изменится. ВНИМАНИЕ НИКОГДА НЕ ОТКРЫВАЙТЕ POE РУ(да и вобще любой) ЧАТ. МНОГО ДОТЕРОВ!

[h3] ХК (Хардкор лига с 1 жизнью) [/h3] Мое мнение про хк по хорошему достойно отдельного обора, но если в краце игра на хардкоре решает многие проблемы. Экономика не такая всратая тк предметы уходят с рынка при смерти, так же играющих людей меньше и люди часто забрасывают игру когда их персонаж умирает. Так же появляется некое подобия скила, тебе уже не так хочется бездумно бежать вперед и ты переживаешь за своего драгоценного персонажа... Но если в игре появляется скил тогда должен появится и баланс, но его нет.. И я не говорю про то что все классы должны быть должны по силе, я говорю скорее про баланс мобов к игроку, вобщем если во время лвлинга прогресия идет более мение равномерно (каждые 3-5лвла ты обновляешь гир и этого хватает чтобы не сдохнуть) В эндгейме тебя в какрй-то момент чем-то ваншотнет и ты играя на варе с 81% резистами не поймешь что случилось (в игре нет логов). Так же для хардкора в игре много садистких приколюх в стиле китйского марио. Например: Зайдя в одну из пещер в джунглях тебя поливает говном(букваьно) и наносит кучу хаотичного урона(почти всегда ван шот тк в третьем акте еще нет нормальных резистов к хаосу) Или (мой любимый пример) Во время битвы с финальным боссом испытания сехем кто-то из разроботчиков затянулся солевой трубкой и выдал гениальную идею - "А что если в середине боя мы дадим боссу полную неуязвимость и разбросаем по карте шарики, авентр орены захуярим гиганские часы, и пускай игрок в стиеле пакмена будет бегать и собирать шарики, а если не успеет собрать мы киним на него стан и пока он будет думать "у меня полгое хп, 3000 энергитического щита и полные 9000 чести, невозможно чтобы меня ваншотнуло" мы просто пропишим скрипт который выдаст сообщение в част что персонаж совершил самоубийство и пройдет через все резисты и пробьют любое количество хп и щита LOL XD. И таких приколов в пое куча.

Edit: After doing research and talking with Grok, I want to refine this review. Yes, I'm doubling down on this negative. What GGG has done is made the game WAY more accesible to new players, but the problem is they didn't stay in that lane. Once you clear the acts and get hooked, you don't realize how steep the learning curve goes at end game. It's very likely the build I've been enjoying and loving (versatle build with different damage types at Tier 6) is not prepared for situations where I have to blow up somethig big fast. The time it takes to research and refine a build in your playstyle is the definition of hardcore gaming rather than casual friendly. Might be worth playing through the acts when it's free still, but the devs should consider toning down the end game complexity if they want a time casual gamer to keep coming back for more.

As long as there's an EXP penalty, not going to recommend this. Gameplay is a lot of fun, but I can't dedicate my life to undoing stupid deaths and losing all level progress. Leveling after 70 is too slow to lose EXP with death, probably never make it to a burning tower because of being time limited. Sad because it's the only real punishing thing I felt I got hit with that I can't work around, but it is one major thing that can completely ruin everything else for casual players.

Path of Exile 2 plays fantastically. It really captures that gritty, dark tone I loved in Diablo 2, and that’s what pulled me in right away. The combat feels tight, and the dodge mechanic is a great addition―fast, responsive, and essential―but maybe a little too quick. My reflexes aren’t always sharp enough to time it right, which led to some frustrating deaths. A slight tweak to that timing window could go a long way.

I played up through the first act’s boss and hit a wall―even in a party of five witches, we couldn’t beat it. The difficulty ramps up fast, and I started to feel underpowered against bosses unless I grinded or teamed up. Revisiting zones just to farm gear or currency felt a little too grindy at times. The class balance also feels off―some builds feel clearly stronger than others, and I saw a lot of players gravitating toward meta choices. There’s a lot of potential for build diversity, but it needs some balancing.

Still, it’s a fun, deep, and satisfying ARPG. I’d recommend it to anyone who enjoys the Diablo-style formula. Just be ready for a learning curve, especially around crafting and character optimization. Get a guide or some early pointers if you're new―this game doesn’t hold your hand, and there’s a lot going on.
IDK, it has issues but I enjoy it.
Can not recommend the current season. Hopefully player feedback will be taken seriously and the next season the game will be fun again.

After finishing campaign a few pro's and cons
Pro: 
Nice to play on steam deck.
Quality content (although short)
Satisfying builds
heated marketplace
nice additions compared to poe1 specially lvling up spells and whatnot.

Cons:
Very short, not enough content.
A lot of bugs: I had 2 missions stuck in a status and I couldn't complete them, also I had problems while playing with a friend, where his campaign didn't complete the mission after he left the party, even though we were on the same mission together.
Very bad optimization: act 2 town is 20 fps constantly, also last level act 2 is terrible to play on.
bad servers lol.
Not a lot of viable builds.

Overall I reccommend the game, is very nice, but keep in mind this is early access, and with that it comes early access quirks like a lot of bugs as I mentioned above, and the game is kinda short atm. I still prefer it compared to poe1 just because of the gameplay, it feels more satisfying and easier to level and build builds.

Also I believe the game is dirt cheap for the price atm, I bought it for 10 usd  (55BRL) in a sale, and I believe it's the best game I've purchased yet for the price. The content is VERY high quality, and the gameplay is super fun.
It's a Unique game with Divine mechanics and other games should definitely Mirror it.

It doesn't value player time past waystone 10. the waystone drop rate is too low and the vendor only has about 10 to sell before it wont sell you any more. It was fun through the campaign, the wisps that you follow go through too many mobs before they hit a boss to buff for rewards so you are likely to die before you reach the buffed boss. you really need to be able to zoom out more to see enemies that potentially one shot you. there are some terrain angles you cant even see your character through so you can get one shot if not careful and lose valuable time with xp. Unless you go energy shield, prepare to be one shot as armor and evasion are not full proof like energy shield is. Mana is extremely low on the recharge rate. Classes are extremely unbalanced. I spent over 850 hours so none of this is to say the game isn't fun, it just has a lot of things it needs to fix to feel it values players time.
if this game has an endless content powered by AI, it would be the best game in history

Наиграв не так много часов как хотелось бы могу сказать. Игра оч прикольная, но есть НО:
1. Виденье разработчиков не всегда сходятся с виденьем игрока
2. Убийство метовых билдов вместо того чтобы их отбалансить и бафнуть мертвые

4. Приколы с мобами на высасывание маны и 40% скорости передвижения, дебафф на скорость передвижения и мусорные карты эндгейма которые легче просто дропнуть чем пытаться перековать или пробеждать.

The game was great until they nerf'ed everything... The whole dynamic is miserable now. I've invested nearly 500 hours on the game. I jumped on today and it sucks so bad, Tier 15's with no juice are an extreme challenge at lvl 95 with s tier gear. The gameplay UI is now crappy and just wish this game could revert back before the crazy update...

I really wanted POE 2 to be a great successor to POE 1 but its clear the direction the game is going is not going to bring GGG the success they or their biggest players want. 

I will be waiting for meaningful updates to the game before I touch it again. GGG's strategy of putting out a subpar product so they can buff it and try to make themselves look good is a terrible strategy when you can make something that is good and far more polished from the get go. Its clear this was far too ambitious of a project and its extremely rushed with most of the game systems being unusable (gems, loot, gear, crafting, and bossing). GGG should have taken another year preparing this and actually play testing before they put it out and now they will be stuck in a very long development hell (fixing bugs and issues while also trying to move development forward) possibly ruining their well established game POE 1.

The game can be fun if you only play meta builds and avoid being creative but the whole romance of POE and the AARPG genre is the allure of freedom of action to build the build you want to. Being able to do any build you want and feeling viable in the endgame and this isn't currently something you can do. The skills are not in the right place. The support gems are not good enough, the overall tree still needs work for many builds to even be viable let alone play in the endgame. 

Whoever is pushing really hard for the souls like feeling AARPG with the POE 1 style endgame needs to re-review what their overall goal of the game actually is and until they reconcile that the game they want to make (vision) and the game they are making do not align the game will continue to be ill perceived. 

I do not recommend ever getting an early access game and expecting it to work well. Wait until the full release is out and you have some reviews to read. If you want to punish yourself and you enjoy it then this game could be good for you but personally for the time I want to invest in this game its not worth my time yet in its current state. Its just too bad this is affecting POE 1 as well. If you do play the game do not support them monetarily until they adjust and make the game better. The only thing companies understand is money so do not give them money until the game is better. 

Good luck GGG.

An otherwise great game let down hugely by tedious boss mechanics such as:-


1. **Excessive Health Pools and Prolonged Battles**  
   Boss fights mostly rely on attrition rather than skill, leading to encounters that last close to 15 minutes. What should be an engaging and dynamic challenge instead becomes boring. Additionally, most boss fights require players to spend most of their time dodging, leaving little opportunity to utilize their own abilities. This further prolongs encounters and diminishes the sense of player agency.

2. **Bosses Moving Off-Screen and Executing Unpredictable Abilities**  
   Bosses frequently leave the player's field of view before performing random abilities, forcing players to guess their next move. This mechanic reduces the ability to react strategically and instead promotes trial-and-error gameplay.

3. **Lack of Clear Indicators for Boss Abilities**  
   Many boss abilities lack sufficient visual or auditory cues. In some cases, by the time an effect appears on-screen, the player is already defeated. The reaction window is insufficient for players to respond effectively. As a result, the only viable strategy is continuous dodging until the attack sequence concludes, which undermines meaningful engagement with mechanics.

4. **Trial System Punishes Failure with Excessive Repetition**  
   Failing at an end boss in a trial requires players to restart the entire trial from the beginning. This process often involves trivial waves that take approximately 10 minutes each, leading to a total reset time of 45 minutes to an hour before reaching the boss again. This design choice appears to disproportionately disadvantage casual players while creating unnecessary frustration for others. Rather than encouraging players to learn boss mechanics or experiment with different builds, this system discourages engagement and promotes player attrition. The approach of artificially extending playtime through repetitive content has historically led to player dissatisfaction in other games, and its inclusion here is counterproductive to fostering an enjoyable experience.

Enfin un MMO ou on retrouve des emotions dans l'exploration et ou tout n'est pas pré maché.
Je suis un ancien d'Everquest, et en effet lorsque j'ai vu l'absence de cartes, de point d'exclamations sur la tête des PNJ, j'ai ete tres heureux. 
Car il faut être honnête, pourquoi faire attention à ce qui nous entour lorsqu'on a une map, pourquoi devoir faire marcher son sens de l'orientation, ses souvenirs, preter attentions à des details visuels, si tout est sur une map. Et pourquoi lire les dialogues et s'interesser à l'histoire du jeu, si tout est deja prémaché avec trop d'indications sur les PNJ.
La je retrouve des sensations. 
Un monde hostile, une mort penalisante, la necessité de toujours faire attention ou on va, car si on meurt, le corps reste sur place avec l'equipement, donc ne pas s'aventurer seul la ou ne pourra jamais recuperer son corps... toutes ces choses qui font le charme d'une belle exploration.

Je ferai le parallèle avec le cinema. On nous bombarde de films à gros budgets qui n'ont plus d'ames, qui sont juste des produits de consomations, a regarder vaguement et puis a jeter. Les MMO ces dernieres années c'est la même chose, quel plaisir de tomber sur peut celui qui reprendra la flambeau d'everquest. 
Je suis conscient que c'est une niche qui plaira à certains joueurs, mais s'il vous plais, continuez comme cela sans concessions, car plaire à tout le monde c'est plaire à nimporte qui et finir aux oubliettes.
Je recommande chaudement !

game_name: Legacy of Kain? Soul Reaver 1&2 Remastered
review: Legacy of Kain is good so is this remaster but I would only recommend it if you are used to playing old games (1999 and 2001 are their release years so early 3D games) or have nostalgia for the series otherwise you'll need to exert a decent amount of patience to go through and possibly use a guide. The good part is the story especially in the second game it's actually interesting and is the thing that kept me going. The bad is the gameplay, the combat in both games is boring and average at best also the controls are clunky which can be a bit frustrating. I would add that the first game got me confused many times on where to go which led to a bit of frustration at times while the second game is completely linear which felt more straightforward. Personally I don't believe in the idiocy of rating while comparing to other games of its time but it's also an old game series so I can cut it some slack so I would rate it 6/10 and I do not have nostalgia for this btw. The short explanation for my score is the story is 8/10 and gameplay is 5/10 so my final score is something in-between.

个人评测能给到8.8/10，古早美漫风的h游，带给我非常独特的体验。
虽然是像素类画风，精良程度却不输于高清立绘。
独特的地下城闯关系统，让人有眼前一亮怀旧感。
人物之间的关系虽然简单，但梳理的具有一定的逻辑性，不会出现让人觉得所有人都是yin娃的怪异感。

缺点：各种令人惋惜的开发程度――
明明加餐般的亮点在于地下城海量的cg，但每个怪物要打好几次，却只有单一cg就会莫名的奇妙的感到单调。
解谜系统是能跟纳迪亚之宝相比的枯燥，战斗系统是一大亮点，但是感觉没有深入开发，非常令人惋惜。

Игра в которую начинаешь играть одной рукой, но заканчиваешь двумя! Приятный сюжет, диалоги без словоблудия (хотя блуда в игре хватает), простенькие, но приятные мини-игры, простые, но приятные персонажи и отличная рисовка из каких-то 90х. Все сделано удобно (галерея удобная, мини-игры всегда доступные, подсказки куда двигать тоже на месте). Не могу придумать ни одного минуса, хотя один есть - слегка душное подземелье, но делать там по большому счету нечего, это скорее опционально (есть некий минимум, но он проходится усилиями в рамках 30 минут). Всем советую!

Overall Review 7-8/10 (depending)
A game with a very nice story, fun gameplay, and good scenes IF you like the style.

READ THIS IF YOU PLAY FOR STORY - 8/10
The story is interesting and will keep your interest it is a bit of a visual novel but the reading does not feel to much.

READ THIS IF YOU PLAY FOR GAMEPLAY - 7/10
Mainly a 7 because "gameplay" is minimal. It is mainly a visual novel but has a couple mini games like serving the beer and the wave based assault game that are fun. 

READ THIS IF YOU PLAY FOR LEWD SCENES - 8/10
Make sure to look them up first as they lean heavily into this specific art style which may not be for everyone BUT in my opinion it is VERY good and the scenes are satisfying for what they are.

I spent a good 20 hours playing Aurelia and i'm just sad that it's over.

The amount of content in this game is just unmatched even for most regular games.
Think of Aurelia as a point and click adventure with a few other minigames in the mix. You even get a small dungeon crawler minigame.

Most of the game you are running errands for the characters you meet and this will unlock your progression throught the story.

The story is good too, has plenty of funny moments and plenty of loveable characters.

The content is all top quality. 
You get a mix of still and animated scenes, all in this beautiful pixel art style (kudos to all the artists that worked on these and the game backgrounds in general, it all looks amazing).

For a porn game, this one is the best there is out there. 
Buy it, just buy it.
If you are ever on the fence wether or not to finally buy an erotic game on your steam account, make sure is this one and just straight up buy it.

Hope to see a 2nd game some time in the future.

Btw, played the whole thing using a steam deck and never had a problem in the 20 something hours it took to complete it.

First off: it's worth the price tag and yes, you will have a good time, even though it's not a Pizza Tower 2.

This game feels like a perfect amalgamation between everything the Megadrive had to offer, and incorporates many ideas from other platformers, be it stylistically or mechanically. I was reminded most of Earthworm Jim, Crash Bandicoot (surprisingly) and Warioland. NOT as much of Sonic, though, I am afraid to say. 

And this is due to the main difference between this and Pizza Tower: the game often stops you in your tracks and brings the character to a standstill when doing moves - which are not as differentiated as in Pizza Tower - which feels like a counter-intuitive idea for this sort of game. Admittedly, it does all look extremely nice, due to the art style. But mechanically speaking, I couldn't quite understand why certain things were happening. You mainly just use a hammer jump move to propel yourself around while whacking enemies, and that's what you do. Most other moves are incorporated into the levels' structure (such as slides etc.) and try to take agency away from the player. In short: the move set itself felt a bit lacking.

Also, this game is quite hard and sometimes there's so much stuff happening on screen that the visual noise is a bit disorienting. Unlike Pizza Tower, I was often about to lose my way a bit or didn't understand what was going on. Not gravely, but noticeably so.

What irked me the most, though, was the music. It's good enough for a Megadrive styled game, but nowhere near Pizza Tower's. In case that is important to you. Not a soundtrack I will ever go back to, anyway. 

Still, all in all, I'm pretty happy to see more of this sort of game, and more than willing to support it. Again: this is by no means a "bad" or even mediocre game. It's good and very polished. It just isn't Pizza Tower, even though it looks every bit like it. If you go into this with the same expectations as I did, you might be a bit disappointed.

Miside это отечественный инди феномен.Выйдя под самый конец 2024 года она взорвала интернет.Мита была просто везде.У меня всегда были проблемы с чем-то хайповым.Far Cry 3,Bioshock Infinite и конечно же FNaF которые я в своё время хейтил но потом покупал и они мне нравились.С Miside ситуация была аналогичная.Хорроры это в принципе жанр который от инди скорее проиграл,но тут постарались явно внести что-то новое.

Сюжет-Мы сыч,у которого один день похож на другой.И вот однажды мы скачиваем на телефон игру где надо ухаживать за девушкой Митой,типа тамагочи.Спустя время нас сами затягивает в игру и мы должны выбраться (или нет,в игре 3 концовки).

Графика-Движок Unity а стилизация выполнена под MMD ролики.Присутствуют разные стили,например сегмент как в 2D новелле.Но зато у игры низкие системные требования и пойдёт на любом ведре.

Звук-Хороший саундтрек и озвучка.Хотя изначально как озвучен ГГ мне не понравилось,но потом привыкаешь.Словно аниме смотришь.

Геймплей-Ходить и собирать предметы основная задача.Боёвки нет,да она особо и не нужна.

Минусы-1)Игра не хватает разнообразия.Да она пытается но выходит не всегда.А иногда откровенно вредит.Манекены из Доктора Кто я про вас говорю.В целом игре не хватает удобств.Нет загрузок с чекпоинтов,только выход в меню.Сами чекпоинты довольно далеко друг от друга и если вам срочно понадобилось уйти то готовьтесь переигрывать чуть ли не с начала.Пугалки примитивные и порой непонятно куда идти и что делать.
2)Миниигры.И я не про них самих а про условия получения за них достижений.Игра требует от вас играть идеально и иного варианта просто нет.Пингвины где снежки слишком мелкие и не может заехать на мост.Гонки где тебя всё время толкают и сбивают.Танцевальный коврик с Кепкой где вы начинаете путать лево и право.И пиком этой хрени является Квадра-Лайнер где вам потом ещё и начинают переворачивать экран и реверсировать управление.Это что вообще такое? Но имея опыт во всяком хентае скажу,там такая же проблема.Просто зачем?

Miside это очередной инди проект который выстрелил за счёт интернета.Он не плохой,вполне себе качественный.Но как и в случе с Фнафом он не то что заслуживает хайпа.Хотя в такую серию явно не превратится.

Пройдя игру на 100% могу ли я её порекомендовать? Определённо да, она полностью оправдывает свою стоимость и однозначно стоит потраченного времени. Кратко пробежимся по пунктам:

СЮЖЕТ: Он есть (было бы странно если бы не было)и он весьма занятный, не могу сказать что интригующий или же поражает своими поворотами которые невозможно предугадать,(возможно) но и не даёт тебе заскучать постоянно подкидывая интересные моменты в общем прописано всё добротно. Хоть некоторые вопросы так и остались без ответов даже после полного прохождения.

ГРАФИКА И ОПТИМИЗАЦИЯ: Стиль приятный глазу,типично анимешный и в этом нет никаких минусов и разумеется эта игра запуститься как по мне даже на Nokia 3310

ПЕРСОНАЖИ И GAMEPLAY: Каждая Мита нам важна, каждая Мита нам нужна! Не могу сказать что они прописаны на отлично ведь экранного времени (за исключением некоторых) у них не то чтобы много а потому полноценно привязаться и что-либо испытывать к ним и их ситуациям тяжело, но даже так тебе на них не наплевать и мало мальски да начинаешь сочувствовать по мере продвижения по сюжету. юмор местами неплох и что особенно приятно так это то,что игра полностью озвучена и озвучена хорошо. Мини игры не сложные и играть в них приятно. Хоррор  составляющая сделана на должном уровне, тебе вряд ли смогут напугать до усрачки если конечно ты не сильно впечатлительный,но при этом будет ощущаться постоянное напряжение особенно при прохождении в первый раз. 

МУЗЫКА И ЗВУКИ: В игре хорошо влияют на атмосферу и задают тон при этом не перетягивая на себя слишком много внимания да и сама по себе не надоедает по мере прохождения (ещё бы она надоела когда игра проходится за часов максимум 5)

ИТОГ: Хорошая и качественно сделанная игрушка на вечер в которую вложили душу и в которую крайне приятно играть 8/10
